text: I can honestly say this is the best Italian food I have had.  Considering I grew up working for my Uncle Nunzie (born in Italy) at his restaurant and I lived 2 doors down from a little old lady from Sicily whose mission seemed to be to feed the entire neighborhood when she could, this is saying a lot.  From the spaghetti and meatballs to the porcetta ragout (my absolute favorite when it is on the menu), from the bread, appetizers and desserts to the sandwiches and bar selection everything is amazing.  The staff is pleasant and attentive, the owners walk the dining area to make sure everything is just right.  It is decorated well and has a terrific atmosphere.
We had lunch catered for our whole office, the food was fantastic! Service was great. I would highly recommend Zappone's and will definitely go back with the family. Thanks again!

AMAZING! AMAZING! AMAZING! My husband & I came across this place when we were looking for a caterer for our wedding. We scheduled a tasting with Dina & everything was absolutely wonderful, so wonderful in fact that they did cater our big day this past Saturday. Dina and her team were phenomenal. They made the evening completely stress free for me. We got compliments on the food all night long!    Also, after our tasting we did become somewhat regulars. Spaghetti & meatball night is our favorite. $5.99 for spaghetti & meatballs, a dinner salad, and fresh bread!

We have been going to Zappone's for years now. This is my favorite Italian Restaurant in Gilbert and Phoenix. Dina and Sal never disappoint.....Love several dishes but the Chianti Braised Beef is out of this world... I would also recommend the Antipasto meat and cheese board...salads are great...Zappone's is  also family friendly and a real value and affordable the pizza is a must....The best Italian in Arizona.....I grew up back east and thought we had great Italian food but this place is a jewel.  Manga Italiano... Ciao !
Just don't understand the rave reviews??? The saying "if you can't say something nice don't say anything at all" comes to mind but  - I really don't get it.

Amazing food! I had them cater my wedding and they did a fantastic job. The food was delicious, the staff was punctual and very helpful. When we set up the appointment to do a tasting they were very accommodating and made us feel welcomed. The owner is very personable and made sure we were well taken care of. They answered any questions promptly and made sure every detail was covered. We had them do a buffet dinner and appetizers for the cocktail hour. The guests all talked about how great the bruschetta appetizers were and how creamy and good the Alfredo was. I would use them to cater another event and recommend them to anyone looking for good quality food.

Just returned from our first and last visit to Zappone's. "Homemade" ravioli? Sure doesn't taste like it. REAL homemade ravioli has a distinctly soft dough, not dough that is hard around the edges and REAL homemade ravioli is filled with fresh sweet ricotta. How do I know what REAL homemade ravioli tastes like? My grandmother made her heavenly ravioli from scratch every holiday and trust me, they were to die for! Sadly, Zappone's presentation doesn't even come close. Hubby's pizza was so-so (we've both had better) but their crust was decent and definitely homemade. The greeters and waitresses were friendly but we still had to ask for sugar for iced tea and the dressing was on the salad instead of on the side as I had asked. Way too many glitches and sadly UNhomemade food for us to pay a return visit.

This is an amazing family owned restaurant. I love to have lunch here at least once a month, great specials, great wine selection, and the staff is super friendly. Favorites are their bruschetta board, chicken caprese sandwich, and their penne ala vodka is a must. Also, Chef Sal has cooking class events that are really fun to attend. I personally haven't used them, but I have heard that their catering service is excellent.

OMG! What a find! Tina who works here recommended this place months ago but I forgot about it. We found a coupon in a mailer and decided to come here for our anniversary no less! And guess what? No regrets! We debated....Fancy restaurant in Scottsdale or play it low key? Glad we came here. First, we got here during happy hour 3-6 and got a Four Peaks 8th St draft for $3! Great price as we were just at Four Peaks and their price was slightly higher. My house red wine was only $4 and delicious. They come out with moist crusty bread accompanied with balsamic vinegar olive oil dip. I hear they bake their own bread. Yummy! We ordered salad, pizza with mushroom and Alfredo chicken rigatoni. The salad and pizza came out quickly. We were so excited about the pizza cause the crust was exactly how we like... Stiff and thin when you hold it up (no pun intended). The sauce was perfect and they did not go cheap on the mushrooms! My pasta was perfect! The sauce wasn't heavy nor salty as I previously had at other establishments. During our meal, we dropped our pizza and beer to the ground! We were so excited to find new hang out we accidentally knocked our food off the table trying to each for a slice! The chef and owner came over and immediately made a new pizza and our waiter got us a new pint. What service. I didn't have room for the cheesecake so I'm taking that home by the looks of it, I'll devour that before midnight. Overall, this is our new hang out. We left when entertainment started but we got to hear a sample. Italian singing?? Really?? Awesome for sure. Can you believe that? Free entertainment! On a Saturday evening. This place is located at a strip mall. No biggie. People here are friendly. Our waiter Andre was purely "grand". Best service in a long time. You'll love this place. I'm coming back with a huge party!!

One of the best kept secrets for Italian dining. Cosy family atmosphere. Low noise level so conversation can be heard without having to yell. If you enjoy great Italian you need to give Zappones a try.   Happy hour from 3:00pm to 6:00pm with great choices in appetizers.  Wait staff great with pleasant personalities and appealing levels of friendliness.   Discovered this place about a year ago and have returned again and again because of the great dink b experience each time.
Loved the food! We've had the Alfredo,  penne with vodka sauce, spaghetti,  and pizza, loved them all! Very friendly and fast service.
Food was good but not fantastic. Small restaurant but cozy. I do like the fact that they offer seasonal cooking classes! Definitely want to try that out.
Awesome awesome awesome. Great atmosphere , fantastic food. Absolutely love this family owned restaurant

I had a wonderful experience on Saturday night. We went around 6 pm and it was getting pretty busy but the server sat us right away.  They have a hostess but she wasn't the one to seat us. The server was very busy but still helpful.  I ordered the seafood linguine but I didn't want the sauces they offered so she quickly helped to come up with a butter garlic sauce and the kitchen did a fabulous job with it. I loved the breads that came with the meal as well as the side salad.  I am definitely coming back.

Tried this quaint little bistro and was very grateful that I did.  Service was great and so was the food.  I am not much for Italian food, but whenever i do plan to eat some, this will be the place I go.  They really seem to care about quality, so works for me.

We visited this restaurant for the first time last night. We were very pleased withe the service and the menu options. I had the eggplant parmesan that came with a side of spaghetti and a salad.  The salad was good and the spaghetti was well prepared. The eggplant was flavorful but only barely warm. I thought the menu was priced adequately too. We plan on trying Zapones again.

We came here based on yelp reviews and can't wait to come back!  As we were told by our server Zappones is run by an Italian couple and they make everything authentic. The bread was heavenly!  The Caesar salad was good. I had the lasagna, which was fresh and had great flavor, so delicious.  Next time I will order with meat sauce as there is very little meat in lasagna traditionally. My husband had the shrimp scampi in rose sauce over fettuccine which was to die for!  He wanted to go back a couple of hours later and have it again.  Our server was sweet and friendly and knowledgable.

We went for dinner tonight at Zappones and were totally impressed. My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to try out something new. I'm not the biggest fan of Italian food, but I must say that this was the best meal we have had at a restaurant in a long time. My wife had the fettuccine with truffle and mushroom, the fettuccine was fresh and the sauce while not overly creamy was a perfect compliment to the pasta. I had the Chianti braised beef over rigatoni. It was not my first choice but when asking the server for her recommendation she said it was the chefs specialty. She was definitely correct. The beef was fork tender, beautifully tasty, rich and simply fantastic. I will definitely be back to have it again. To finish off a great meal we both had desert. My wife had the mascarpone cheesecake, it was light and flavourful. I had the chocolate grand mariner cake with ice cream, orange caramel and foam. It was spectacular. The service was fantastic and very attentive, and not only our own waitress but all servers seemed to help each other out, never letting a glass stay empty, or a dirty plate stay on the table. We can't wait to go back on our next visit to Gilbert.
Dina and Sal Zappone have created a little gem in the East Valley! The best Italian food served with a smile and you can't forget the warm homemade bread! Love it!!!

As a restaurant guy, working in the industry for 24 yrs I come to find a certain level of service or scrutiny.   That being said, this place surpassed all my expectations.  Everyone was working as a team, everyone was genuinely nice, everyone had a smile an were happy.  I told my wife, this is the kind of restaurant I would want if I ever opened one.  The food was great, the service was great, the live music was perfect for the space.  We will be back!  In my top 5 of all restaurants in my life.  Erin was an amazing server, Tony was top notch as a buser/helper.
Whenever I have a pasta craving...Zappone's is where I go.  The atmosphere is quaint and comfortable.  I always take my visitors here and everyone has been impressed.
Hey. Y'all. Great place. Jus saying. I work at two great places in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. This is good! Homemade pastas. Calamari to die.

We stopped by because we had just checked into our hotel and wanted a quick lunch and it was nearby. We are in Phoenix often to visit our son but we almost always eat near Scottsdale.  This place is in an unlikely location  in a newly developing part of the East Valley.  What a find! We have traveled widely in Italy, where you can't get a bad meal. The food here is equally terrific. We had the mussels, the arugula salad with shaved fennel, the prosciutto flatbread, and a simple pasta dish. All wonderful. Perfect tomato sauce....just like in Rome and environs. A lovely young couple run the place. They have live music some nights. Last night they served the Feast of the Seven Fishes. Dang...we missed it!  But we are retuning tomorrow for dinner for sure.
Amazing food and great service! The pizza was out of this world and the atmosphere was clean, calm and beautiful. Highly recommended!

Tonight was our second visit to this restaurant. What prompted our initial visit was a recommendation from a friend, who claimed that this was the best fettuccine alfredo she had ever tasted and that the pasta was made fresh. The alfredo is good but it's no different than the one I make at home from a recipe off of Pinterest and the pasta is definitely NOT fresh. I now question everything that my friend recommends lol. Anyway, our first visit was fine even though I wasn't impressed. Now our second visit, that was bad. First of all, our waiter was mediocre. The type to do the bare minimum -no refills, never checks in to see if you need anything and seems bothered to even be there. All of the other tables around us seemed to be getting great service from other staff so we were probably just unlucky.  I ordered the wild mushroom fettuccine. The sauce was so watery that it would not stick to the pasta thus rendering it flavorless. I added copious amounts of salt in an attempt to coax some flavor out of it. I'm not sure that we'll be back any time soon but I will say that I'd rather give a local restaurant my business rather than a place like Olive Garden.
The bruschetta is amazing! The waitress was  kind enough to open the patio for us. We ate an Italian chopped salad and bruschetta trio. Everything was so fresh and delicious. Bonus there was no wait!

This was our first visit and we actually went for the live music but we loved the food as well. The fried gnocchi were little pillows of lusciousness. They were followed rather quickly by a very fresh house salad that had green olives, roasted red peppers and mixed greens. We had veal and chicken piccata which was a perfect pairing of tangy lemon, capers and cream over an artfully placed base of rapini, cherry  tomatoes, and artichoke hearts. The veal was the winner here as it worked best with the picatta flavors. The espresso was good and the deserts ample. The staff was very attentive. The only complaint was the pacing of our meal was a bit rushed. Nevertheless we will go back to try other menu items.

So far I have had the fried ravioli, spaghetti & meatballs, and lasagne. They were all amazing, however the portion sizes were too small. I felt like I needed to order a second entree because I was still hungry. If they would increase portion sizes, this place would definitely be 5 stars

This isn't just my favorite new Italian restaurant, it's my favorite new restaurant, period! I am a serious foodie, and it's difficult to make me happy (just ask my friends and family). Also the quantity of REALLY GOOD food I have eaten in this state is almost too small to measure. So where do I start with Zappone's? It's everything you ever wanted in a casual Italian place. The service is friendly, efficient and very accommodating. Like, can I order that, but leave that off or add that kind of thing. Again, with the ME being picky. The food is beautiful, freshly made in-house, and in terms of the flavor, ranks up there with any Italian I've eaten anywhere (S.F., LA, etc). At least one reviewer was totally incorrect - not only do they use the very freshest ingredients, they will only use certain special cheeses and sausage they import from Italy.  My faves so far? Well if I have to pick; Eggplant Rolatini, handmade Ravioli, Enzo Pizza, Pork Milanese, House Salad, Bolognese sauce....and I haven't made it all the way through the menu yet :) The daily fresh bread is baked right there by Chef Sal and is available for purchase to take home.  Since I'm also a wine lover, I appreciate that the wine is priced reasonably (seriously, there are places you can pay over $10 for a glass of Kendall-Jackson - ridiculous!), and that the wine list is growing to include more boutique wines and greater variety. I like it there so much I have had two events there for my wine group, and both were amazing with the food, service and wine.   And yea I know there's paint on the windows, but do you have any idea how many restaurants have gone out of business here??? I'm not a fan of the paint either, but I don't care as long as they stay in business and I can keep eating there!  If you went when they first opened, you need to go again!  (just so you know, I never write Yelp reviews....)

Sal's pizza rocks! His authentic Italian food is amazing and it shows that he know what he is doing when it come to food!   Can't wait for their new bar/lounge area to open!!   Thanks Sal and Dina for a great meal!

I admit it. I'm a fusspot. Often people will look at me strangely and go "What kind of Italian are you?!" The answer? One who when she finds golden food, will return time and time again. Still need more convincing? I find no problems in driving the 40 minutes or so distance from Scottsdale to Zappone's. Most(if not all) ingredients are I believe imported from Italy.  I have seen this labor of love grow since December, and from what I understand Sal and Dina have some great ideas to keep the décor and environment fresh and new. I believe there will be TVs soon and a longer area for a bar.   For appetizers, my ultimate favorite is the calamari. Chef  Sal's doing his a new way now, I believe adding lemon and more flavors, however he's still willing to do it his old way- just ask for it :)   Now the kicker. Now is where people truly think I'm weird. When I find a great meal, I don't like to switch things up and will stay with my tried and true, old reliable. The reason? Simple. What if I don't like the new meal? Then I wasted money on something I don't want, when I could have stayed with something good all along. My "Tried and true" at Zappone's is *drum roll* Their pizza! Cheesy, light crust, crunchy-but not burned, yet also not gooey and undercooked. Simply perfection.  Not big on wine, so I can't comment on selection or even taste, but there's a lot to pick from.  Staff is friendly, and it's great to see Dina working right along side them. I think that's refreshing to see. What she makes them do, she'd do herself. If you have any questions on the food, ingredients, or how it's prepared, ask for Dina or Alex.

Zappone's Italian Bistro in Gilbert provides excellent catering services for any budget.  We recently had them cater a family anniversary party for my sister and all our guests raved about the quality of the food.  I would highly recommend them for any celebration you may be planning.  Dina Zappone is knowledgable, professional, and gives 110% to ensure you and your guests are satisfied.  Thank you Dina, you are the best!

Ate dinner for the first time at this local italian restaurant. The food was fresh, well prepared and tasty. Our appetizer of mussels in red marinara sauce was positively wonderful! Had chicken marsala and that was also great. Prices were pretty reasonable, too. Disappointed that we had no bread on our table as I have read reviews that it was fantastic. Will remember to ask for it next time as we intend to go here again.

I am an Italian food snob because my family is Italian and I grew up on authentic Italian foods.   Rarely have I come across a worthy Italian eatery in the Phoenix area.   Look no more, this one is going on my list of regulars.   The truffle mushroom pizza is to die for!
AMAZING FOOD! I had the chicken pesto sandwich with house salad it was to die for. Will definitely go back!

We learned about this restaurant from a recent review in the AZ Republic.    We just got back from an early dinner and it was authentically Italian!!!!     The bread was truly Italian, chewy crust and not sweet.    The food was very tasty and delicious.  The dessert sampler was amazing.   Great place, not expensive and the chef Sal and his wife Dina (the owners) are delightful and very welcoming.     Will definitely be going back soon.   A great find in the east valley!

This place was an amazing find!! Nicely decorated and the customer service was over and above any expectation! And if that isn't enough to get you here then let me tell you about the delicious food. The owner bakes the bread from scratch as well as homemade pastas. I had penne a la vodka which was so delicious. Hubby had pasta with clams and mussels which he loved and probably will come back here just for that! We topped of the dinner with dessert. Heaven.

We selected Zappone's to cater our wedding. We had several different places set up to try but after meeting with Dina we knew we had found the right place and cancelled our other appointments. Dina made us feel welcome, served us AMAZING food and has been more than helpful with menu selections and ideas. She even went by our venue to get an idea of set up and flow for the evening. We have eaten there many times as well and each time the food has been outstanding. Overall, they have gone above and beyond with wonderful customer service and great food. 5 stars for sure!!

My husband is from Rhode Island and knows his Italian. He gives the red sauce a thumbs up! The place is really charming, the decor is like a Godfather scene. Pasta with meatballs was great, antipasti salad and bruschetta were yummy!

Finally getting Zappone's and I must say it is delicious!  The arugula and prosciutto flatbread has to be the best thing I've eaten in ages!  I am very anxious to come back and try more items on the menu!

Had lunch at Zappone's Bistro today and all I have to say...it was an exquisite Italian culinary experience.  We ate family style and from the bruschetta to the dessert it was a delight.  The food was prepared fresh to order with a lot of "love" and the service was perfect as well.  I live in Scottsdale and this would give Andreoli's a run for their money!  Great job!  Wonderful food and experience.  Thank you!

I ordered takeout tonight from Zappone's. I have never eaten here prior, usually takeout is lacking the quality you usually get sitting in, not tonight.  Atmosphere was welcoming.  The ladies that helped me are very nice and the food was awesome.  I highly recommend the artichoke dip and the Alfredo tortellini.  To top it off I ordered 20 minutes before they closed and picked the food up 2 minutes prior to closing.  I will be returning regularly after discover this place.
The food was awsome, Erin the server was very attentive. We had Italian sandwich and Meatball marinara sandwich and calamari as apetizer. I liked the garlic touch in the calamari .

Had dinner there the other night. Food was great, and the personnel where attentive. Owner was constantly avalible to the customers and checked to make sure everything was as they wanted. Pricing is right .

We have been to this restaurant twice now.  This is a family owned restaurant.  The owner and staff are awesome.  They make you feel as though you are part of the family.  The food is very good.  Dinners are served with salad.  You can choose a garden salad or a caesar salad.  On both occasions we had the  garden salad  which was simple but so fresh and yummy.  Last time, for dinner, I had the butternut squash ravioli (just ok) and the BF had the bolognese substitute homemade fettucini.  His dish was delicious!  This time I had he eggplant rolatini.  It was two very small pieces of rolled eggplant with marinara sauce over them.  Very tasty but they looked so sad on the plate all by themselves. It is served with a side of pasta that is in a separate bowl so definitely enough food.  BF had the porchetta with rigatoni.  OMG!  Once again, delish.  So far, it seems that the meat dishes are a big hit.  Next time I'm going to try the clams linguini though.  They also have a nice wine selection that is decently priced.  The food prices are reasonable as well.  Just go...you won't be sorry.

Absolutely love this place. Always looking for good Italian, and this hit the nail on the head! We started with a High West Whiskey Cocktail and a Tiramisu Martini. Both were delicious in their own right. Dinner was even better. My partner had the Rigatoni Al Forno. The red sauce was incredibly seasoned and definitely not from a can. I enjoyed the Wild Mushroom Fettucini and added the Chianti Braised Beef. We enjoyed every last bite of our meals and sadly were unable to order dessert as a consequence. We will definitely be back and possibly start with the dessert next time!

I like Zappone's a lot!  The best part is that it is reasonably quiet so I could have a long lunch and great conversation with a friend.  The music is of varied types, but kept very low.  The food was very good.  The service was excellent.  Megan was very skilled at being at the table at just the right times and not being an intrusion otherwise during our leisurely lunch.  We shared a big salad first...excellent...followed by a pizza.  The pizza was slow to arrive which didn't matter as we had salad and were in no hurry.  When it did arrive it was excellent, great crust.  Later Megan brought us complimentary cannolis because the pizza was delayed.  She explained the chef wasn't happy with the crust on the pizza and remade it for us, thus the delay. I didn't love the large, painted ads in the front windows...tacky.  Otherwise, it was excellent.  I will be back. It was was an excellent lunch experience.

Fantastic! I took my 2 boys for a quick dinner. They both loved it as well. My youngest said he's coming back every day. This is everything you want from an Italian Bistro: great flavors, fresh ingredients, varied menu, an atmosphere that's casual enough to run in for a quick bite but nice enough to linger over a bottle of wine, and a price point that keeps the value in the bistro restaurant. Well done Zappone's!

This was a nice experience. The restaurant was not busy at the time, around 3:00 pm. The server was very good, friendly and sincere. The spaghetti and meat ball bowl was excellent, and it was for only $5.99! I would definitely go back again the next time I drop into town.

I am from out of town and my daughter is a picky eater. I stopped by to order a to-go plate  plain speghetti. This place looks and smells amazing. The lovely hostess was sweet and enjoyable. Thank you Zappones for the noodles. I will be back!!!!

Forget reading all reviews and just go!!!  This place is awesome!!!  My husband is culinary trained and it's hard to find a restaurant where he is happy to spend his money.  Well this is one of the very few.  Every plate of food we have had in the place has been delicious.  You can tell it is family ran because you can taste the love and the joy of cooking in the food.  And the dessert.... there are just no words so order it or if you are full take it home with you.  I am so glad we found this place!!!

I've been here twice.  First time was eh... 6.5 out of 10, so thought I would give it another try thinking it would be better the second time around.  Shamefully disappointed with the second.  I ordered a "Margherita pizza w/ pepperoni to go"  Not too hard right? (i.e. basil, mozzarella, marinara, w/ pepperoni).  I got home and saw it had no basil, but that was only part of it.  The ingredients they put on were so cold that it made a big sloppy mess once the pie warmed up; the ingredients never cooked.  By the time I got home, the pizza box was soaked through from the liquid coming out of the ingredients, and it was only three ingredients!.  No one likes a soggy bottom...I will not be going back.

Excellent experience. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.  Food was a hit from beginning to end. House made bread was perfect and started things off just right.  The bread really captured the Southern Italian flavor I prefer.  The chef and owner was super kind and came out to our table. Service was right there too we didn't want for anything. I had the eggplant and I would highly suggest that.  I was with two other folks and we all enjoyed the entrees. We missed the pizza and will be sure to try that next time.  Super authentic, definite attention to the "little" things - I am looking forward to going back.  Get the Cannoli - they make it to order - like they should !

The mac and cheese is an original take- if it wasn't called mac and cheese I wouldn't have known it was supposed to be mac and cheese.  And it's excellent!  The penne ala vodka, the margherita pizza, and the house salad were great, too!

I cannot say enough about Zappone's!!! My fiance and I decided to have our engagement party here, and the food is amazing. From the bruschetta trio to the salad to the bread to the chicken marsala and penne to the cannoli.....EVERYTHING was spot on! The service was great and our guests wanted for nothing. And it was extremely reasonable! Dina didn't even charge me for two people when they cancelled on me the morning of the event. She updated quotes as the number of guests increased, was always quick to respond to emails or texts, and even let us store our cake there for several hours before the event. She made up the most darling little menu cards with our names, the date, and the menu. Thank you Zappone's for making our event memorable on a budget. My compliments to Dina and Sal.

Forget Olive Garden!!!! This place is amazing. Authentic food and attentive waitstaff. This is our new favorite Italian restaurant. The chicken Marsala was amazing and the lasagna, forget about it. Hands down as real as in Sicily.

Wow, this place is off the chart amazing for Italian food.  The prices are incredibly reasonable.  Everything was made to order in the kitchen by the owner Sal.  He does not skimp on quality and you can taste it in the dishes he prepares.  I am so picky about Italian food and this is the best in Arizona.  I truly felt like I was in little Italy in New York eating at 5 star restaurant that has been open for over a hundred years.  After speaking with Sal I know why.  His family is from Italy and his grandmother and mother taught him how to cook Italian food at a young age.  After years of training in the restaurant industry He and his wife decided to take a leap of faith and open up this restaurant 7 months ago.  It doesn't matter where you live in Arizona, You have to make this a must stop!  We tried The Amatriciana(absolutely incredible), the porcini raviolis, chicken parmesan, and this cheese stuffed pastry dessert, which was to die for.  We also ordered the calamari, but not fried, sautéed in a red sauce that was exquisite.  This wasn't on the menu but we asked to have this made.  I am looking forward to taking the next cooking class he offers and attending a wine dinner in the future.  Don't forget to take a loaf of bread home for sandwiches or French toast the next day. And most importantly they do 50% off bottles of wine on Tuesdays.  We had the Vitiano, Italian Blend which was a great bottle with a full flavor.  Enjoy
Great service, fantastic home made bread, easy to OD on the bread.  Had pizza one time, it was very soggy.  All pasta dishes have been exceptional.

3 THINGS:  1) Zappone's Italian Bistro's serving staff is top notch; They are efficient and fluid with their techniques. i.e. Our server was very respectful of our large family group at Mothers Day brunch and was receptive to re-filling half-filled glasses with jaguar-like stealthiness as not to interrupt our conversation during an already overly-busy day....huge kudos for doing that. 2)  I'm a self-proclaimed salad connoisseur. The Italian Chopped Salad is off the charts. We are talking a finely chopped dark green romaine salad...none of that cheap light green salad...also it is chopped 1 cm x 1 cm on average. FINE! Mix in equally finely chopped Italian salami, fresh mozzarella, olives, red peppers, drizzled with a fine red wine vinaigrette. I only wish I took a photo before I inhaled this salad. Good sized salad too.  3)  I'm sure the other entrees are as good as their Italian Chopped Salad which means I can't wait to go back to try their Spicy Italian Calzone.

Had a very nice meal and service. Ordered their special for Monday night, spaghetti with meatball and house salad. Also ordered their pistachio cheese cake that was so creamy. I have found a new favorite Italian restaurant.

We just came back from your Valentine special. WOW!!!! The food was amazing, the best flavoured soup I have ever eaten. The pasta was done to perfection and the steak and lobster my husband had was so tender he could cut it with a fork. The service was wonderful on such a busy night. Thanks for giving us the best Valentines night ever! Last year we were in Florida and this was so much better.

I gave it 3 stars for the following: the staff and management are nothing short of excellent. They truly made sure I was a happy customer. I recommend visiting this restaurant on that basis. The quality of their food seems to very high - all I tried tasted fresh and served at the appropriate temperature.  That said, I did not like the taste of their food. Not at all. The marinara sauce was a bright red tomato sauce that was to me, very bitter. Not tangy, but bitter. The Italian chicken soup was also bitter, seemingly too spicy.  Overall, 5 stars for the staff and management,  no stars for food taste meant to me 3 stars.

The food was wonderful.  We started with the fried artichoke, which was very lightly breaded and a delicious dipping sauce.  Janessa I think was our server and Was very efficient and pleasant.  The Chicken Saltimboca was outstanding!  The only reason I did not give 5stars is there is no atmosphere.  It is in a strip mall but it would not be a Saturday night date choice.  It is all tables with nothing, not sure if it meant something but a car painted on the wall.  Let's make it look Itallian.  Maybe some red checkered table clothes, a candle on the table, a scene from Italy on the wall.  Some screens or plants to offer a little separation.  This place is awesome just need to ambience.
Not an Italian Fan but the seafood fettuccine was good as well as the warm olive appetizer. Nice and close to the hotel so I may have to try it again next week!

Wow, I can" t believe we have not gone to this place before. What great food and service. We started out with the Bruschetta trio, which was one the best I have ever had . The bread is incredible and the toppings are so fresh. Next time I could just order a couple of those and a few  beers and be a very happy man. Anyway we also had veal which was awesome and an order of pasta with meatballs and sausage. The sausage was good but the meatballs were probably in the top 5 of all time. Listen I am Italian and I have eaten alot of meatballs in my time but these are some of the best, not as good as mine but up there. Try this place, you will luv it.
Yummy. I ordered the Chicken Marsala and my husband got Chicken Parmesan, both were delish!  The side Caesar salad was great too. Service was timely..highly recommend

Just heard about Zappone's and so we tried it out for lunch. First impression are important. Mine was that someone needs to change the mop bucket (was Bieber in there?). Walked through the door and was greeted by a putrid smell; like the floor had been mopped with a mildewed mop. Not very appetizing,  but we stayed. Server was quick to seat us and take our drink orders and bring out some bread with a small cup of olive oil/balsamic. I ordered the Penne Rose and lunch buddy ordered the Spaghetti Marinara.  The penne dish was tasty, but not remarkable. Lunch buddy felt the sauce on her spaghetti shouldn't be described as marinara; it was just sauce.  We weren't impressed, but may give it another try.

Had a fabulous time with excellent food and live music on a Saturday night. My wild mushroom fettuccine with chicken was to die for and the creme Brule cheesecake was out of this world. No waiting on the day after Christmas. ..a major plus in our eyes...when though the place was hopping!

To start with Sally and I loved this place but we were hungry, and this is our first visit. I had the butternut squash. It is outstanding. The house salad was crisp, fresh and a very good flavor, Sally had the Caeser salad and it was also very good. Sally had the baked Penny and she loved it, quantity was ample she couldn't finish it. I had the chicken Saltimbocca. This was outstanding. It was a chicken Marcello plus chicken Parmesan plus, plus, very good I would give it a five out of five. We will be back

This was a great stop to satisfy an Italian craving. I loved that "Extra Virgin" (Debi Mazar + hubby cooking show) was on in the background in the lunch hour. A solid offering and lots of power flavors from the antipasto plate to the pasta.

I stumbled across this gem their 2nd day in business. I had no idea it was day 2, and was super surprised when I found that out. This family's spin on homemade Italian is some of the best I have ever had. Even though I never was able to frequent the place more than once every 2-3 months, they always remembered me when I walked in. They always remembered my regular order, including the drink. And what can I say about the bread, it's amazing. I salivate just thinking about it, even though I haven't been in Arizona to go back in a year and a half. I would gladly recommend this to anyone and everyone. Great food, great experience.

Went to a cooking demonstration and had a wonderful time! The menu was Panzanella, Spinach and Cheese Ravioli with vodka sauce (homemade pasta!), Tuscan Roasted Chicken with Potatoes, and Limoncello Tiramisu. We were shown how to make every dish, given full size portions of each course and a glass of wine for just $35! Fantastic food, charming chef owner too. I'll be back!

had a great dinner. The Veal dish was excellent. Love their Margareta's. Also, the artichoke appetizer was fantastic and a pretty big portion. only reason for 4 stars was the service was a little slow but they were pretty busy. will go there for dinner again

What can I say Zappones has some of the FINEST Italian food in the valley, The staff and owners here are wonderful accommodating people and my wife and I will continue to go here for some kickin appetizers and pastas.  I worked with them to put together an amazing grooms dinner at their restaurant and I lost count at the amount of compliments we got for how this place rivals some of the best in NY. Mind you my whole Italian family flew in from NY and have run an Italian speciality store and we're impressed!

Moved to Chandler 2 years ago from NY. We have found a few Italian restaurants in the area but this place is by far the best. The service and wait staff are amazing. The shrimp Rosa with homemade fettuccine is my favorite.   The husband and wife are always there engaging with there customers. They truly care about everything going on and it shows.   Just my opinion, I can boil water at home and empty a box of pasta into the water. When we go out to eat, fresh pasta is a treat.  This place reminds me of Home, truly a gem. Give it a try you will not be disappointed.

**To-Go Order**  I was craving Italian so naturally I turned to Yelp for something close. I called in my to-go order and was helped by a very happy and helpful hostess. I asked questions about their menu and she explained in great detail about the entree's. I ended up ordering the Chicken Picatta (I am a sucker for lemon and capers.) The chicken was cooked right, the cream sauce was okay it could have used more seasoning. The spinach was good, but the sauteed veggies were a little on the mushy side. The meal came with a mini salad which was fresh and their pesto dressing which was enjoyable. My brother ordered the Spaghetti & Meatballs, which he said was good and noted the sauce was a little on the sweet side.   All in all it was an "A-Ok" experience. The food was prepared quickly and the service was friendly and well priced.

I am having horrible heartburn. I was up all night and was throwing up. Thats partly due to my stubborness for not getting antiacid. My wife did the smart thing. I had beef sliders.   Nice atmosphere, tables too small. The table we were seated was wobbly. Service was slow. Took about one hour to get our main dishes. Bruschetta was OK but could have been better.   Waitresses did not know which dish was which when food was served. I decided to skip. Once biten twice shy.

Overall this is a nice place that I enjoyed, but my wife wasn't overjoyed with; I wouldn't mind going there again.   Calimari appetizer was quite good, lightly fried, not rubbery, good sauces, one with some kick. The bread we got was a bit of a disappointment; it wasn't warm or very flavorful. Caesar salads were average, and took a while, even though we got there before the dinner rush on a Saturday night.   I had the chicken marsala, my wife had the shrimp scampi with Alfredo sauce. I enjoyed the chicken, which came with a size of spaghetti with mushrooms, which was also good. My wife didn't care for the shrimp scampi and found the Alfredo sauce thin, though I found it flavorful and think the shrimp were prepared perfectly. Neither of us knew what to make of the large red onions in the dish. (They were out of the homemade butternut squash ravioli, even though the dinner rush had just started. I didn't find that out til I ordered it.)   Great, attentive service. Not much for ambience. Just a big, open room, somewhat brightly lit for dinner. FYI happy hour is 3-5 daily; some earlier reviews reported 3-6.

My Husband & I came here Friday to celebrate our 10th Anniversary....worst service ever. We waited at least 20 minutes to just order our food then another 30 minutes to get our food. Anytime we needed anything it took forever just for our waitress to acknowledge us & to get the bill took about another 20 minutes. On top of that food was just OK, wasn't anything special. We have been to other places that are WAY better like Babbo's. We won't unfortunately be coming here again. I would rather go somewhere with better food & SERVICE.

So life has been pretty stressful lately.  Gravity appears to becoming stronger, or I'm gaining weight.  Somebody is dying my perfectly black hair with some stray white ones.  My friends claim that I'm in denial, but they just don't realize I will never turn 30.  I have some wedding vows to write, and a tennis buddy insists that it will come to me at a sushi restaurant after 2 sake bombers, and I'm almost desperate enough to go that route.  North Korea seems to want to play with nukes.    But you know what really bothers me?  Zappone's Italian Bistro having only 3.5 stars.  Are you kidding me Arizona?  Fine, I'm getting older and gaining weight and graying out, fine I'll probably plagiarize somebody's vows online, fine another Korean War is inevitable, but no freaking way is Zappone's 3.5 stars.    We've been coming here since December, and probably been back about half a dozen times.  The interior is very smartly designed with a modernist look but also comfy booths and bar/counter top seating throughout.  The food is expertly made, and just tonight I had a gnocchi special that blew my mind- great chew on this freshly made pasta with every bite having a little uniqueness, coated with pancetta, onions, chili flakes, in a rich, slightly tart marinara sauce.  My fiancee had a lovely spinach ravioli special, that was Miss America pretty to look at but Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition satisfying.  Their house salad is a little different every time, this time sporting more sweet  peppers than normal but perfect for me, though YMMV.  Their calamari had a perfectly light breading, and extremely thinly sliced lemon was also battered and flash fried to make a perfect accompaniment to the marinara sauce.  Prior visits had the lasagna, tortellini, and spaghetti ala mare been extraordinarily enticing.    The only Italian restaurant I've had in the east valley that compares to Zappone's is La Calabria, and the cost is probably about half of theirs.  The staff has been ridiculously welcoming, and service has been comfortable yet still professional.  I've always had to drive a fair distance to get an Italian meal I really enjoyed, but am ecstatic that I've got a great restaurant about 2 miles away.  If you're still reading my review you must have a lot of patience, and you should reward yourself with a visit to Zappone's.  Be forewarned however, you might just fall in love with the food, write silly reviews, maybe even belittle the seriousness of Korean War part deux- and like me, find that it was all totally worth it.

My fiancé and I were wanting a little Italian food that was super close to the house.  We really enjoyed this little place!  IMPECCABLE  service and great food!  We started with the Bruschetta appetizer, it was very good!  I had the chianti braised beef rigatoni.  It was just what I was in the mood for!  Thick, tender, and delicious.  Paired it with a Super Tuscan blend.  Very tasty. My woman got the margarita pizza.  She loved it.  I tried a piece and I enjoyed it.  Pretty greasy, but we like that.   Overall, this place isn't gourmet by ANY stretch, but if you want some straight forward Italian food in the East Valley, I would recommend it!!!

When we want Italian we go to Zappones--very close to our home and every dish has been fantastic!!! Have to say that the pizza is in my top 5!!! Love supporting local businesses and highly recommend trying them out
Authentic food that radiates flavors of fresh garlic in the luscious sauce and meatballs, delicious mushrooms,  and slow braised meet. I give this fabulous place my highest recommendation.

Zappone's is still new, but you can tell they really care about producing quality food and providing great service. I've tried several of the dishes and so far the standouts were the house made Fettucine Bolognese, the Bruschetta and Pizza. The Pork Milianese Sandwich was a little on the dry side. Could use a punch of sauce. All in all, great start so far, looking forward to going again and seeing them find their groove.

What a great find, we found this little Italian restaurant in a strip mall, but don't let that fool you the food is amazing.  Meat from Chicago, homemade bread, and pasta cooked RIGHT!  Which is hard to find in Arizona.    Check this place out before you can't get in, when everybody finds out how good it is.

East Valley, very good Italian food, very friendly and attentive customer service, nice selection of wines. Ok, now for the review. I had the manicotti and Susan had the antipasti. Both were very good and we are anxious to try something else on the menu. The bread is made by the chef and very good. They did not get 5 stars because I think the ambiance could be improved on. I have always heard when restaurants start painting advertising on their windows it means their business is slacking off. When we walked up I said uh oh... painting on the windows. Fortunately the pizza advertising didn't take away from our experience.

Zappone's ToGo was GREAT! i was dining alone, and i was glad to take it home with all my "Nom-Nom" sounds! It. Was. Delicious! My first time here, i asked Sarah what she suggested, and the Wild Mushroom fettuccine with Chianti braised beef was FANTASTIC! They took as much care as they would had i dined in. The plate came out hot, the house salad was fresh and tangy, and the BREAD?? THE BREAD WAS PERFECTO! so tasty and chewy, perfect with pasta. If you are carb-watching, just resign yourself to going to the gym nextdoor- do not skip on the bread. The price was fair, considering the pasta came with salad and bread, plus the delicious quality. I cannot wait to come back to eat in, and try the other options!
Great atmosphere for a quaint neighborhood restaurant. Wine selection was good and the food was even better. Staff was helpful and knowledgeable.  This will definitely become a usual stop.

I've been here two more times now dining in, and I haven't been as impressed as my initial visits where I only did take out.  Service is definitely an issue. It takes awhile for the food to come out. Our salad came out with our pizza just as I was ready to cancel it. The female owner is an amazing hostess and server, but the other waitstaff is inexperienced and don't have the same "hustle" that she does.   I am still in love with their fresh baked bread, but when it's served at the restaurant, it comes with awful olive oil for dipping. It's totally flavorless. One the plus side, the starter salad was even better than what I remembered from take out. Perfectly dressed with green olives and roasted red peppers. I got the eggplant parm (off the menu), and I was warned it was non-traditional i.e. no breading. It was great! But the pasta it came with was almost drowning in oil.  I was disappointed with the funghi pizza that we got. The mushrooms were underseasoned, and the truffle oil made it taste a little off. Hey all restaurants, can we agree to stop using truffle oil? It's just chemical flavoring and has nothing to do with a real truffle ::::end rant::::  I would still recommend Zappone's but with some reservations.

I have been traveling to Arizona since 1998 visiting family. I am there at least every other month.  when my family told me that this Italian restaurant opened. we had to go check it out - being Italian and from the east coast, I am happy to say, this is PHENOMENAL !!  turns out, the owner is from my hometown!!! it is a small world and although he moved out west in the 90's - and I didn't know him from back home because he is younger than me, his calling was to open this restaurant!!! my family goes there every week or so. and when I am there to visit, it's our go to place! everything is excellent.  sandwiches, salads, entrees, and desserts, leave room for dessert!! they  make you feel like family when you walk in! they are so friendly and it is a very casual atmosphere. and they cater too! so if you are having a party, have them cater!
This is our favorite neighborhood spot! The food is delicious, service is outstanding, and the cheesecake is amazing! We always enjoy coming in for wine, appetizers, dinner and dessert! Love it here!

We had an event catered for 10 people recently and our experience was amazing. We had very particular food restrictions that I thought might be difficult for an Italian restaurant (wheat and dairy free). Dina was amazing and very easily accommodated our request. she came up with an awesome chicken dish with a side of roasted veggies and an salad and right at the price point we were looking for. It was delicious, everyone here loved it.

Zappone's is very close to our house, and we enjoy the food. I wish their Alfredo sauce had a little more flavor (like some more garlic flavor maybe?) but we will come back. We went on a Friday once and were plesantly surprised by the live music! That singer actually helped me (unintentionally) pick a song for our first dance at our wedding by playing a Jason Mraz song! :)
Had the Braised Beef, Homemade Cheese Ravioli with Meat Sauce and the Lobster Diablo. Trio of Bruschetta was STELLAR! Apples, honey. Caprese. Fig and Prosciutto. Whoa! Love this place!!

AZ italian food continues to disappoint. There was one redeeming quality...the bread...and maybe the salad.   The red sauce was flavorless and I've had better out of a jar (victoria's is great btw), nothing like you'd find in nyc or boston.   Eggplant parm was not properly prepared. Eggplant was was bitter and not salted and rinsed... Not a fan.   The calamari was chewy but the garlic was a nice addition, could be overpowering for some.   Service was amateur hour at it's finest. I could hear the servers at the bar area loudly discussing amongst each other about their shifts, how the kitchen was backed up, and orders coming out wrong, etc... No one wants to hear that.   Needless to say I won't be back nor would I recommend this restaurant to anyone

The good: pasta perfectly cooked, good homemade fettuccini, waitress was friendly, pumpkin cheesecake, wine The bad: depressing music, salad was overly dressed and soggy, bread dry, place was cold and empty

We received correspondence from this spot. Thank you for taking your time.  We did verify the number we provided to GrubHub. It was a working number. We also rang the spot when the promise delivery time was not fulfilled to follow up with our order. All we were told was "It's on the way!" With a bit of an annoyed and hurried tone from the lady we spoke with. Hung up without letting us interject with our inquiry.  We love supporting mum and pop local shoppes. But we require proper service. One of them is keeping what was promised - timely delivery. Waiting for delivery of cold pizza, and appetizer for nearly two hours... Is not at all timely.

Oh my gosh this place has the best Italian food. So light, so fresh. Excellent chef and menu. We went on a night when they were having Dueling Pianos. Some good laughs and a few sing alongs. Highly recommended
omfg why does yelp make we type so much. isn't a simple star enough?

Staff was friendly, atmosphere was nice. The pasta we ordered was good, but the pizza was only so-so.   We requested to move tables after the waitress mopped up a spilled drink. The mop's disgusting stench filled the air. If you're reading this, clean it in some bleach or something!

Great food, I had the chianti braised pasta, generous amount of braised beef with gravy over pasta, small bits of veggies throughout.  My mom had the penne al vodka.  I think I liked that dish even better.  Great light & tasty house salad.  I read reviews before going,  somebody said they didn't get the 4 or 5 star reviews.  Well, I didn't get your two star review.  I can't wait to try other menu items.  Salted caramel Gelato....the bomb

I like this place, I live across the street, so I go here a lot, but I do have one complaint.  If I am going to pay $14 dollars for pasta, sauce, and  is described to have rapini in it, then I sure hope I am actually getting rapini and not frozen broccoli..  I do know the difference and I was not happy that my pasta as described with rapini was merely brocolli..... so that is all I wanted to say.  If I am wrong and you absolutely 1000% only serve rapini, then I would like to see proof. Thank you  oh, and also.. the ceasar salad was drenched in cheap parmesan.. whatever happened to shavings?

I have eaten at Zappone's Italian Bistro and been to an event catered by them. The food was delicious. The red gravy has been consistently tasty without an acidic bite. The Pizza has a nice flavor. The beef was out of this world!   By the way, over the holidays, a week or so ago, I brought a couple of their, pipe it yourself, cannoli kits to parties I attended. Everyone loved them, too! (and  of course, I gave them the credit)  If you enjoy authentic Sicilian style Italian cooking you will enjoy the food at Zappone's Italian Bistro.
Best Italian restaurant, not just in the East Valley/ Gilbert but all of Arizona. Great pizza and sandwiches with friendly staff and a quaint ambiance. This is our go to place for good Italian.

Been there several times. Food is very good but this time the service was way below their standards. We had to wait for EVERYTHING. We began to think we had been forgotten even though we were in plain sight. Took quite awhile to get our drinks and another very long time for the waitress to come back to take our order. Then had a long wait before our salads arrived. And so on........  Not a good experience this time. Hope they fix this.

My first experience with them was not the best, although after the follow up I received from the owners I gave them another try! The service was great and food was delicious! Can't wait to try more of their dishes!

Worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time. Waited over an hour and a half to get our food and then it was not hot. We continually asked when we would be getting our food and the answer was always "you're up next". It was very tasty and would have been more appreciated arriving sooner and hot.  I would not go to this restaurant again.

We had high hopes as we headed out to Zappone's for dinner. We are big pizza aficionados. We brought our son, daughter in law and grand baby with us. We both ordered the pizza margarita. We were very disappointed. I give them one star for using fresh buffalo mozzarella, but other than that, it was bland. The sauce had not a lick of flavor. The pizza was almost a liquid, melted mess. It had no flavor at all. The crust was probably ok, but without any flavor in the sauce it tasted like nothing. Each pizza was $18, for cheese pizza. I had hoped with all these 5 stars it would be like Pizza Bianco, but alas, it was not. The waitress was very nice and the establishment was clean. That's about it. Also we ordered the Caesar salad. Again, no real flavor at all. Sorry Zappone's. We really wanted to like you.

Zappone's is my restaurant of choice for Italian food! The meals are consistently fresh and the staff is always attentive without being intrusive. It's a great spot for a date night where you can enjoy a conversation and not feel rushed. The live entertainment adds to the cozy ambiance.

Everything about this restaurant is delightful....the owners, the staff, the ambiance, and especially the food.  The gluten free chicken piccata was DELISH!  It's a great place to take your family for dinner or maybe go on a little date night with your hubby.  You must try a home made dessert  after your meal or you will definitely being missing out!

This place is to die for!! Best Italian restaurant I've ever been to hands down. Everything from the food to the staff is absolutely impeccable. Everyone always makes sure you feel welcomed and leave happy. (Especially the owners Sal & Dina!) The food is very authentic, service is fast, and food is delicious! These are the little golden, hidden places that yelp is made for. If you're around the area I totally recommend coming here, you won't be disappointed!

I called with an urgent need to send food to a family after a tragic loss. I spoke to Dena and she was so kind and helpful and was prepared to have the catering delivered in an hour. When I called back to let her know I had to change the delivery time she was gracious and understanding. I wish more business practiced this kind of customer service. Thank you Dena!

Really impressed!  First of all, I didn't expect to find an Italian restaurant of such high quality in the suburbs of Phoenix.  The service was on point as well!  I had a hard time choosing what to get because everything on the menu looked awesome.  Finally I decided on the rolled eggplant which came with a side of pasta.  It was a nice, well-seasoned, light dish and was also a perfect portion (quality over quantity!).  All of the pasta dishes/entrees come with either a caesar or house salad as well.  Huge plus!   We loved the complimentary bread and so happy to be given both olive oil and butter.  Also, the waitress informed me almost all the pastas are made in house except one or two (can't remember which) and had one that was out.. I LOVE hearing this because you know what you're getting is FRESH!   Everyone in our party loved their food!

I've been here a few times in the last couple years and have always enjoyed the food and service.    My wife and I decided to order take out tonight and when I went to pick up the food I forgot to grab the garlic bread I purchased. Their employee Kaylee called and left me a voicemail and offered to take it off my bill if I didn't want to come back and grab it. I know that doesn't seem like a big deal, but I truly was impressed in their service. I'm happy that there is an Italian restaurant in the East Valley that has such great food AND customer service.     100% will recommend this restaurant to l my family and friends.    Ps. Spaghetti and meatballs! Get it!

Our first visit to Zappone's was early on a Tuesday. We were graciously greeted at the door and promptly waited on by Andre. To be sure Andre is one of the finest servers I've encountered in a long time. He was prompt, knowledgeable and seemed to honestly like working at the establishment as did all the wait staff we encountered. 5 stars to the staff.  We both chose the spaghetti and meatball $5.99 special which includes a house salad and bread.  The house salad was perfect 5 stars. The bread is house made with an excellent crust and texture but missing just something in the flavor. The spaghetti was good but the sauce not memorable. The meatball also was good but a little denser than we prefer.  3 stars for the spaghetti and meatballs.  I understand that the linguini and lasagna pasta is house made so will definitely come back to try them and give another sauce a try.

This is the best little Italian place we've come across in the Phoenix metro area so far. Their pizza and pasta are awesome and the pancetta is some of the best we've had in a restaurant. Definitely worth the stop

You know I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in here with a friend to try it for the first time but I was impressed from the moment I opened the door. The decor is very tasteful and the atmosphere welcoming. We were dressed casually but as it is lunch hour nobody seemed to mind and most of the other customers were in work clothing and equally as casual dress.  The service was exceptional and the food was absolutely delicious. The pizza is some of the best I've had in the ten years I've lived here. Definitely give this place a try if you haven't. :)

I came across Zappone's when I was looking for a restaurant to host my company holiday dinner.  My husband & I went there for a trial dinner & we were more than pleasantly surprised.  We felt like we were eating at a restaurant back in NY! The food was delicious & the staff was extremely pleasant & helpful.  Dina, the owner, was not only helpful with helping to plan the dinner but very easy to work with. We have since been back numerous times before my company dinner & will even be dining at Zappone's New Year's Eve.  We have found our new favorite neighborhood dining spot!
Excellent food! Fantastic service!! Our waitress was amazing! We ordered the pizza and a Caesar salad. Both were great! Will definitely be going back!!

This was a great find when I came out for a Cardinals game from Las Vegas.  We stumbled upon here the first week they were open with friends that live in the area.  It is a cute place, designed for the local market with great food and service.  The Pizza, Chicken Parm and of course the sauce ... are awesome.   I cant wait to stop in again the next time I am in AZ.

Amazing food! Fresh made pasta!  Great service. Had the Chicken Marsala, probably the best I've ever had.   Love this place, never get ti  As usual, Sal and Dina have done an amazing job on Mother's Day!

One of my favs.  Food is awesome, staff is great, they just remodeled and it looks great,,,Stop by for their great lunch specials too!!  The owners work every day and are committed to you having a wonderful dining experience

What a wonderful find. I was craving pasta and clams. Very tasty and light. I was told Pastas are homemade as are the breads. This is true. Best small salad to finish this delicious fare.  The staff is excellent, Kailey was informative and helpful. Dina introduced herself after the meal, she oversees this quaint and delightful bistro. Great experience and plenty of items to look forward to at my new favorite Italian place.

The food was amazing. Everything great about this place is all about the food. Did I mention that the food was great? The service was good as well and they were super busy.  Now for the other stuff: Live music courtesy of Dan the guitar guy. Per the flyer that I folded up and put under the leg of our table to stop it from wobbling, he plays everything and takes no breaks. At least he played some classics like That's Amore! Just kidding, he didn't . Lightning Crashes..very romantic.  Please takes some breaks!   Very small and very loud.  I'll be going back because the food is that good. They do take-out. :)
This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants.  The owners and wait staff are wonderful and the food is delicious.  I highly recommend Zappone's Italian Bistro.

Wow! I am Sicilian and I have never left a restaurant being this impressed... Other than my Nanas kitchen it's pretty hard to satisfy me when it comes to Italian food. Thank God I found the spot! I had the braised beef pasta dish, The beef melted in my mouth. The sauce is light and decadent while being rich and satisfying. There is so much beef in this dish just when I wanted another bite I would flip over a pasta and find another mound of it. I cannot wait to work my way down this entire menu. Grazie e perfecto!!

Update: The owner of the restaurant promptly contacted me after I wrote my review, Apologizing and offering to make it right. I appreciate that. It shows good stature on their end. I will up my rating from 1 to 3.     Went here with my husband and two small children March 21 2018. The service was horrible. I understand being busy, which they were, but completely unorganized and poor attitudes. It took 25 minutes before our order got taken. 5 minutes till drink order 10 min for drinks another 5 after I had to ask for a kids menu for the second time and another 5 after they left us again so we could look at the kids menu which took 2 seconds. After waiting another 20 min for food, a different waitress brought our food out. Saying " enjoy your food okay" walked away with an attitude. We hadn't said anything or complained nothing to deserve this type of crappy attitude.  The food was not the tastiest. My kids pizza was burned, my noodles weren't fully cooked it just wasnt what I was reading in the reviews. Totally the reason why we went there in the first place. This place needs help and the staff needs an attitude adjustment. Very poor service. Will not go back.

Had seen the chef on a local TV show, so met friends there for dinner, was very disappointed.  I know they make their own bread, we received 4 small slices for 4 people.  Food was OK, but not anything to rave about.  Disappointed!

Watch out for the different sizes of noodles. If you order  fettuccine noodles instead of spaghetti noodles they charge $2.00 more. Also the garlic bread portions are either generous or skimpy depending on "how he slices the bread'. This used to be our favorite restaurant but to be sooooo trivial about these things has turned us away! And when we ordered the fettuccine noodles not once did the server mention that there was an additional charge for the noodles.

I am not much of an Italian food eater, but I really enjoyed my Chicken Piccata with a side salad and side of Angle Hair Pasta.  You get all of this for the cost of your entree. I was with a party of nine and everyone enjoyed what they ordered from the Fritio Misto, Veal, Pizza, chicken, and Marscopone Cheesecake to the Americano coffee. Portions are healthy and most come with a salad (house or Ceasears) and a side of Pasta. You get to choose your Pasta and  Pasta sauce. They are so flexible and accommodating. Hannah is the owner and is a working owner. You can tell she loves what she does and takes responsibility. Dina the manager is right there with her. Our server Kaily was very knowledgeable about the menu and had also tasted the food so she knew what she was talking about. I highly recommend this restaurant. It is popular so be patient, it is worth the wait. Did I forget to mention the French bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil? It is a small serving, but do not be mad, helps leave room for dinner.

Dropped in for a second visit today with my Son for lunch. We liked that we could eat in a relatively quiet restaurant and peruse the menu without being rushed.  Today we both ordered calzones...my son had the spicy and I asked for one with mushrooms, sausage, & roasted onions . we both had marinara to dip.  As an added feature we opted to share a full order of Italian Chopped Salad so delicious I would order it again and savor it myself with either cheese or garlic bread. The calzones were large and not a disappointment but would have preferred asking that it be overstuffed next time maybe with more onions and mushrooms. I will consider ordering again but the flavor if the Chianti Beef from my first visit still lingers in memory.  I highly recommend the refreshing antipasto laced chopped salad and Chianti beef in any variation. I am surprised it is not on the Valentine Day special dinner...it is that good. We will be back...so many other menu items to try IF I can forego the Beef or Chopped Salad to try something else.

Went here for the first time last week and was thoroughly impressed. I live literally two blocks away across Baseline so I was thrilled to have a very yummy place nearby. Here's what we ordered:  Cocktail -- Nicely done Negroni. It's so rare to find a Negroni on the drink menu at a restaurant 'round these parts. It's my favorite cocktail, so that's a huge plus.  Warm olives -- A very large portion in a generous serving plate. And the chef added fresh oregano to the olives, which was a bright addition to the dish. Very nice.  Calamari -- To my surprise, along with the tender calamari came paper-thin slices of breaded and fried lemon. Genius!! I've never seen that before, and what an amazing accompaniment.  Caprese salad -- Again, a generous portion and served with arugula, if I recall. Very fresh and outstanding use of ingredients.  Mushroom and Onion Pizza -- The crust was amazing. Best pizza for miles.   Dessert -- Three gelatos with cookies atop each serving. I was expecting a little melon ball's worth of gelato. But no, each one was more like a single ice cream scoop. You can't go wrong for $5.  To sum up, I think the chef must be making a good impression with super-large portions or promotional pricing, because the prices are honestly too low for the portions and the quality served here. It's a fantastic restaurant with outstanding food. I can't wait to try the entire menu. As an added bonus, kids meals are free on Saturday afternoons so my son's spaghetti and meatballs were on the house.
Great little gym just off the 60 in Mesa. Good daily special $6.99 for spaghetti and meatballs, can't beat it! Great service great atmosphere.

We had lunch catered for a party.  We worked with Dina for the order.  Our order was ready when needed for pickup.  Everyone loved the food!  It was all so delicious and very reasonable priced!  We will definitely be ordering for future events again!
I love the food, the service & the atmosphere!   Sal is the best!  I'll be there for date nite with the wife Saturday!  Mike
Zappone's is a place we're going back to! The food was great and the staff was very friendly & helpful. Get the cheesecake ~ so good!
Spaghettios and ketchup with taco beef I would say about their  gnocchi Bolognese  no flavor at all, very bland disappointed spent 16$ on crap!

My husband took me to my favorite Italian restaurant, Zappone's, and the food was absolutely delicious. We had a big lunch so decided to try their pizza. It was fantastic! We ordered the 16" "Tuscan Chicken" pizza with marinara rather than alfredo sauce and it was plenty of food for the two of us. The pizza had a very generous amount of chicken and the mushrooms & onions were cooked perfectly. It seems to me that every detail is important to the chef. While waiting for the pizza our server, Heather, brought out a delicious crusty bread with an aromatic virgin olive oil that we enjoyed. In the past we have ordered many of the entrees on the menu and the chef has a special touch. The servers are attentive & friendly. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys delicious food.

Pizza was delicious. We made our own - pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom. Tina was our waitress and she was excellent. The owner came to our table to check on us. We brought our two small kids and they loved the food too. I would recommend it to anyone.

Our neighborhood go to spot!! Everything is amazing---and they are always adding new things to the menu!!!  Staff is friendly and very accompanying! Loving "giving the business " to a locally owned restaurant!!!
Yum, got the lunch calzone, it's great, I can't believe I stopped eating it to write this review. Friendly staff. Great place.

I accidentally drove here thinking it was another restaurant and I am so happy I did. This place is off the charts!!! This is the first time I've had authentic Italian food and I can never go back. My boys loved it as well. Would've posted more pictures of the food if i wasn't so busy eating.

Last night we picked Zappone's for dinner to start our celebration of Dads 90th birthday.  Because there were 11 of us I want won't go into detail on each dish that we had but most of us we very happy and satisfied with what we ordered. For the 3 unfortunate family members that ordered the Saturday night special, they were left sitting looking hungrily at the rest of us as they finished their dish in just a few spoonfuls. DONT ORDER THE SPECIAL OF THE DAY.   Now I understand it's August and we are under an excessive heat advisory, however I do not want to go to a nice restaurant and sit and sweat throughout my entire meal. The thermostat was on the wall above our table and was reading 83 degrees. REALLY. I asked twice if they would please lower the A/C as it was very uncomfortable. My request was ignored.   I love Zappone's food which is one of the reasons we choose to have dinner here last night. I guess it's time to look elsewhere again

We had a party of 7 tonight for the dueling pianos!  The service was amazing! We had the fried artichokes, they were delicious! We also had pizza and salad, everything was delicious.  On top of the food and service being fantastic, they also had entertainment! Az Dueling Pianos was so much fun! I love that there is somewhere close by that offers great food and entertainment!  Nice work!!

We were here the other night for dinner and it was pretty good overall.   Nice atmosphere, small and cozy. Happy hour every day 3-6pm has some nice options for drinks, appetizers, and desserts that are very affordable.  Service was great, we were there pretty early for dinner, and we were greeted right away and never wanted for anything. They boxed the food up for us at the end which was nice.   We were initially brought some sourdough bread which was soft and delicious. Our meals included salads and I had the Caesar and my boyfriend had the house salad. He loved his house salad with red roasted peppers, tomatoes, and olives. Mine was not bad but really overdressed, the leaves were soaked in dressing which some people may like but was just a bit much for me.  We had the artichoke dip appetizer served with toasted bread slices and this was awesome (about 5 on the happy hour price). I really enjoyed this. For dinner I ordered the shrimp scampi linguine (14) with a pink scampi sauce which was good, but not something I'd order a second time. My boyfriend had the chicken alfredo (10) and he wasn't a fan, mostly due to the underseasoning. I liked it better than he did but I definitely thought both the chicken and the sauce was underseasoned. Dessert we ordered the warm chocolate cookie with gelato (4 on happy hour) which was good and gelato was excellent.   So overall, price is good, service for us was great, atmosphere nice and the food we had was either amazing or meh. I'd be happy to come here again but it won't become one of my local haunts.
Ordered takeout today pasta, couple of appetizers and a couple of sandwiches. Food as always was excellent and the service as well. Everyone always treats you like family.

Always the best. Love love love their cheesecake and their food is authentic Italian. I think I have had all their dishes and never been disappointed. Getting take out tonight because I don't want to cook.
The food, service, and happy hour are very good! The live music was nice and not too loud to have normal conversation. The fried artichokes and Capone pizza are a must try!  Go enjoy this place.

My hubby and I were driving around for about an hour trying to find somewhere to eat that we haven't tried before so after a while Zappones showed up on yelp and we decided to give it a try... Well we're super happy to say that we did! My hubby ordered the clams in a garlic cream sauce under the apps as his meal, I ordered the chicken piccata and our daughter had spaghetti w/meatballs and it was all so good!! Everything was very fresh and tasted amazing! The waitress was super sweet and knowledgable suggesting their specials and also telling us how the pastas and bread were made fresh in house;) my only complaint is the portions were a lil small but since it was so good I wanted more lol I actually found myself using the homemade bread to soak up the left over sauces on our plates because it was so good! We will be back for sure! Thank you Zappones for a great dinner experience!

My fiancée and I found this place and loved the service and the food so much that we are having Them cater our wedding. The owner Dina is amazing and the taste testing was delicious. Do not hesitate to hire them for any occasion.
Been there twice in 1 week, the food and service is amazing . My new favorite Italian restaurant by far. Can't wait To try some other stuff on the menu!!!!

Listen - a lot of the pastas are homemade and even the ones that are not are perfectly cooked and the sauces are savory and delicious.  The bread is light and chewy at the same time and served with olive oil.  Salads are fresh and perfectly dressed.  Ambiance is very nice - mellow music, tasteful art.  Service is impeccable.  Only regret I had was not saving room for dessert.  We'll definitely be back.

We went to Zappones today after purchasing a groupon, we are so happy to have found a great local Italian restaurant! We tried the caprese salad: arugula, grape tomatoes, fresh mozzarella tossed in balsamic...delicious, very fresh. We also ordered a pepperoni mushroom pizza: thin, crispy, fresh. The ambiance is great, small, with a wine lounge and tall booths. We will definitely be going back!
The rose sauce was excellent, as was the service.  Definitely try the Pancetta Dates, they are delicious!

After seeing a review for New Years Eve in the Arizona Republic, we put it on out to br tried list.  Went Friday night and we were not disappointed.   We arrived before 6 and sat in bar area (its not a huge bar ) very nice.  We took advantage of happy hour appetizer, fried ravioli. The were hot and creamy on the inside. Perfectly fried. Crispy without having hard edges.   Entrees come with your choice of house salad or Caesar. We had one of each. The house salad comes with a light vinaigrette, fresh spinach and mixed greens, roasted red peppers and green olives  My husband had the butternut squash ravioli and what I can tell you is he did not offer to share and they did not have to wash his plate when it when back to the kitchen   I tend to order spaghetti and meatballs the first time I go to a neighborhood Italian resyaurant, sort of my judgement meal.  Now I don't want to try anything else it was so good.  I probably took more home than I ate.  The meatballs were over the top good.  We finished are meal with an Amaretto Marscapone Cheesecake.  It's a must try.  Almost hate to rate them well, afraid they will become too popular.  So happy to have found them, love having a good local Italian restaurant within 4 miles of home.  Can't wait to go back.   PS. Everything that went passed our table looked phenomenal

Took my wife to dinner here, over the weekend, looking for a different Italian spot. The food & service were on point. The atmosphere was cool. My wife had the Chicken Parmesan & I had the Lobster Fra Diavolo, which we both enjoyed! I'd try it again!!!

Been here twice.  First time was decent because they had a deal through Yelp for an app, 2 entrees, dessert and a drink each for 30 or so bucks.  They screwed up my pasta but the server made up for it.  This time our server took our order and never came back.  Asked for bread 4 times and nothing until we were completely done.
