Ordered spaghetti and sausage no cheese but they bring it with tons of cheese.  Sent back and wait for the new dish.  Had to practically beg for another drink because nobody came around.  I'm not going back.

I was thoroughly delighted by their fresh made bread. It was delectable. The staff was extremely friendly and made thoughtful dinner selection options.  Although, the sandwiches were reasonably priced and tasty, their chicken pesto sandwich loaded with mayonnaise gave me a wicked stomach ache. The jury is still out on that one. Having said that,  I would still recommend this place to friends and will be going back.
Just stopped by for some apps... amazing and great service!! Will be back for a full dinner service but this bruschetta is to die for.

I love this place! We only went once for happy hour, but we'll definitely be back. We had drinks and ate like pigs and the check was only $39. Even when it's not happy hour the prices are very good. And the server was wonderful and perfectly attentive. We had mussels, antipasta, pizza, truffle potato chips (YUM) and more and everything was very very good.

This place is freaking amazing!! A little hole in the wall that I am so glad I found.   They have an amazing happy hour deal- 50% off their Italian wine bottles!!   I ordered their Lobster Fettuccine, which was freaking amazing. They are very generous with their lobster and the sauce was just amazing. My husband ordered their Seafood Fettuccine, which was also phenomenal. They basically put the entire ocean in the dish. Had plenty of mussel, shrimp, and calamari.   I am definitely going back soon for a date night with the hubby and saving room for dessert!

We were in Phoenix visiting family and my parents said we had to go here.  They were right!  Chef Sal's food is delicious.  I just wish I could have kissed Mama Rosa for her spaghetti and meatballs.  My wife LOVED the lasagna.  We took the Calabrese pizza home and later it was wonderful.  The olives, calamari and antipasti plate will all be ordered again.  Next time we are in town we will bring more family and friends and hopefully be able to order one of everything!!!  Order at the counter and they will take care of the rest.  Wonderful food and service.

After a less than satisfying visit a few months back we recently tried their food again.  As previously stated, the Enzo pizza was good.  So were the lasagna and the penne in alfredo sauce.  Guess it depends on what you order, when you order it, and what your standards are.

We had a wonderful dinner at Zappones. We had the mussels as a appetizer. Wonderful! I had the beef ravioli, Thom had the eggplant both were excellent. Deena and her staff were very attentive. When you in the mood for Italian come to Zappones

We were looking for good Italian food and decided to try this place based on the reviews. The place was surprisingly packed for a rainy evening so we decided to wait the 20 minutes for a table. We ordered drinks while we waited and were a little disappointed that an $8 glass of wine was not filled at least half way. We were walked to a table that the hostess warned us was wet and we had to ask for it to be dried. Once we were seated and ordered, our very small salads came quickly but we had no silverware or napkins. Eventually we were able to let our server know and she fixed the problem.  The live music was fun but, a bit loud. This is definitely a family friendly environment as children were running between the tables going outside to play and marching back in between the tables while we were attempting to eat. This seemed to be the norm with the staff and the patrons. I have never seen such a thing.  The food was alright, it really was in dire need of some serious seasoning. My spaghetti tasted like pasta with tomato sauce and the chicken parmesan tasted like it came from the freezer. His small portion of chicken marsala was thin over some broccoli. The cannoli  had a strange flavor and the nuts on it made our mouths dry, not good.   Overall it was an alright experience, no where near all the great reviews it received. I don't know that we will be back.  Not a date night type of place.

I should try there pizza next time. I ended up getting the chef special spinach Ravioli and it was 7 small raviolis for around 13 or 14 dollars. I was told afterward that it was one of the smallest portions on the menu. I do not recommend it.  My wife ordered a sandwich and it was dripping with way too much oil. I told them that I would most likely not come back but I may try the pizza some day if that is what they are good at.

My husband & I ate here for the first time last Sat & are going back this Sat. It was wonderful; everything from the staff to the service to the food was welcoming, delicious and extremely accommodating. Coming from NY we have found it hard to find good Italian food out here but Zappone's delivers on all fronts. Our waitress Kaylie was on top of her game & as nice as could be. We are totally a fan & can't wait to have another Zappone's dinner experience.

It's time once again to try a local place we have not been to. I was in the mood for Italian. Went to Yelp of course to look this place up and saw that they are getting good reviews so it was a go. We went yesterday (a Wednesday) around 4:00pm. We were the only ones there. Our server Tina, was very nice and very helpful. We told her this was our first time here and asked for suggestions. She brought us some home made bread with some olive oil to dip it in , yum! Next we had the Eggplant and zucchini flat bread appetizer, soooo good. Now time for our dinner. My wife ordered a new menu item, Chianti braised beef rigatoni, which she loved, and I had the Lasagna, which I loved. Both came with a side salad of your choice. Even the Iced Tea was really good! My glass was never empty, Tina made sure of that. We were both full, but we had to try a dessert to make this dinner complete. Our server once again gave us choices, and we shared a piece of homemade Coconut cheese cake. This is not New york style ,its made with Ricotta cheese, and it was so light, so..........GREAT! I don't really like Cheesecake, but this was such a nice change. I would come back just for this.   The only thing that would make this dinner better, a slightly larger serving of the Lasagna. The prices do run a bit higher then some places, but the quality of the food your are eating is worth it. The service was excellent, the food excellent!, we will be back! I give this place a big "WOO HOO!"

This place is a freaking disaster and nightmare. They have to be paying people to go on and write reviews because I can't believe anyone would actually return to this establishment.   First of all it's an Italian restaurant in a strip mall next to a sushi joint and a closed down Indian buffet. I don't know why that makes them think they can charge $13 a plate for chicken alfredo but regardless we ordered.   I ordered the lasagna and my bf ordered the chicken alfredo. They both came with salads. I asked for blue cheese with my house (which I didn't get) and my boyfriend who hates salad got the Caesar. Ps we asked if he could substitute the small side salad for anything else like soup and the waitress said no.   The house dressing was so salty it burned my lips, sorry, I don't enjoy salt on my salad.   Then the food finally came and my boyfriends alfredo was dried out and again soooo salty and my lasagna... don't even get me started... disgusting... AGAIN SALTY... what is with the fricken salt!!  We were starving and hoping for large portions but we only managed to choke down half of our mediocre portions of overpriced food.  If you thought that was bad then you should hear about our drinks... My bf ordered bud light which they only had 2 bottles on site so then he had to drink their draft beer and pay the price of their stupid craft draft beer...   We finally got our check and I knew it was going to be expensive but the waitress charged me $7 each for my well vodka and diet drink... Who the H3LL charges $7 for a well drink!!?!? The BF's Bud Lights were $6.50 TOTAL. I thought it must be a mistake so I asked the waitress if that was the case (maybe she entered the drink wrong) which she did... It should have been $6 for a well and diet?!?!? WTH She said she would refund my $2 but by that point she could keep her $2 and shove it...   We promptly walked over to Desert Babes Sports Grille, where I got a well and diet for $3 my bf got a big bud light for $3.75 and ordered a delicious appetizer to settle our starving stomachs.  Horrible, expensive and disgusting.. I hope to g0d they close soon.

The Popeye pizza was very good.  That's about the only thing great. Dirty plate was brought to table.  Bread was brought only after having to ask.  There was no butter or olive oil served to go with bread.  Took server several minutes to bring Parmesan cheese to table after pizza was served.  They were out Ingrediants to make the orange mojito. Out of Bud Light.  Too many great options in Gilbert to go here again. Very disappointed.  Was looking for this place to be great.

Love Zappone's Bistro!  Great atmosphere, and the staff is really nice.  The food is great, and they are very accommodating with menu requests.  We love the Monday/Tuesday pasta special!  They also have fun special events.  So glad we live close by!

I got the lasagna and it was absolutely delicious. My guest with me this evening received the fettuccine alfredo and she didn't like it. I tasted it and thought the same thing - it was bland. The owner's wife came out and was very kind and sweet and offered us replacement dish. So we got the chicken parmesan. Much better, so thanks to the owners wife and the waitress for being so responsive in this situation.   Cheers! We'll be coming back!!   Ps. After writing the review and the check came to the table, they had compensated chicken parmesan and the cannoli desert that we ordered; which was delicious by the way!

I've been to Zappone's several times, usually for happy hour. Great ambience and the food is fantastic, particularly "The Italian" sandwich and their "mini" pizza which wasn't mini at all. The bread is addictive - be sure to ask for extra if you dine in. Service is always friendly and prompt. Even when I don't have time to dine in, it's great to swing by for take out!
Great food, friendly owners! Love that it's close to home so we can come often. The butternut squash ravioli is so yummy! We also love the fried ravioli and Caesar salad.

Zappone's is one of our favorite Italian restaurants in the Valley. Owners Sal and Dina Zappone are awesome. Sal makes the bread and pasta from scratch and everything we have there is delicious. Can't beat the half-priced bottles of wine on Tuesday. Live music on the weekend and special wine dinners that are reasonably priced keep us coming back at least every other week. See Sal on Sonoran Living and some other local morning shows. He's personable and fun!

If you think Ragu is good spaghetti sauce and want to pay top dollar for it this might be the place for you. The eggplant rollatini was awful and tasteless. I'm not sure how the made the ricotta filling tastlest as well but it's actually impressive because they pulled it off. I scooped out the filling to taste it and it tasted like baked cottage cheese. The side spaghetti exposed the flavorless sauce that obviously came from a can. The Ceasar salad was good and the butterfinger cheese cake was decent. I would never go back and I recommend that anyone that has ever had good Italian food avoid this place.

Great little local italian joint, wife & tried it for the first time tonight.  She was very specific what she wanted ... Good Italian ... NOT a chain!  Her mom suggested Zappone's, so we decided to give it a shot.  We shared the Tomato Jam, Goat Cheese & Arugula flatbread ... really more like a pizza with those ingredients (with arugula put on after/fresh).  Delicious but about enough for 4 rather than 2 ... like many Apps go.  Literally it was more than I could've eaten for dinner if that was my only dish.  Wife got the homemade ravioli and liked the sauce and pasta filling just fine, but found the noodle portion a bit more 'al-dente' than she's used to.  Not worth sending back or anything as it wasn't 'crisp' (it's homemade, right, so it can't be), but a little more 'done' would've been nice.      On our waitresses suggestion (her name was Teresa and she was helpful, smiling, and attentive throughout, although we were her only customers on the patio outside), I tried the Chicken Saltimbucco (sp?) and boy that was a great call.  Starter Caesar was nice, though I like a LITTLE 'stronger' Caesar dressing than what they offer (a tiny bit more vinegar/lemon juice/salt in the mix relative to the other 'stuff' IMHO would make it perfect), but if you like a milder/cheesier Caesar you'll love it.  AFA the main course goes, the Chicken and it's sauce were delicious, those were perfectly cooked.  The veggies under the breast (zuchs, red bell peppers) could've stood to be a little more 'al-dente' but they weren't mush or anything, I still ate 'em right up.  That also came with a basic bowl of rigatoni w/alfredo & parmesan on the side, that was a nice compliment to the main dish.  Best of all, they had a 'live band' ... well, a dude with an elaborate drum machine/keyboard setup that made it sound like he was a whole band by himself, and he was great.  Played sweet 70's rock the whole time ... Eagles, Pink Floyd, Christopher Cross, Styx, that sorta stuff.  At the end of the night (we got there late) the guy even let me sit next to him at the mike and sing lead on a song while he played (and reminded me of the lyrics as we went along lol) ... We did a little "Brown-Eyed Girl", one of the wife's favorites.  Then I got him to close the night with Space Oddity (RIP David!) that I loudly sang along with from my table nearby, helped HIM remember the words on that one ... So that was FUN!  However, since he was playing somewhat loudly (not to me, but I could see SOMEone feeling it was loud) in the small dining room, it was not exactly quiet in there ... and dining room itself is relatively small and fairly tightly packed ... so, well, don't expect an quiet/intimate dinner unless you call ahead and make sure there's no 'band' playing when you're there.  Because of that we sat on the patio where we could still hear the music but still talk easily until we finished with dinner ... then we went inside to hang out and rock out.  Best of both worlds, you might say.  So ... food 4.0, service 4.5, band-dude 5.0 ... so let's round up and go with 5, esp. since they're a locally-owned business.  Remember ... BUY LOCAL, people!!!

Why have I not been here yet! This is a neat find for sure. Customer service is fantastic. We came in with a large group (20ish). Not only did they accommodate us, they gave us service that was phenomenal. Drinks were always full and the staff was so friendly and helpful. If they do that with a large group, I cannot imagine what they would do with a small group.   The food.... Absolutely fantastic. I got the carleone and my wife got the mushroom fettuccini. The ingredients were fresh and the flavor was fantastic. You can taste the quality with every bite. Do yourself a favor and try the garlic cheese bread. It's so good!   We will be back for sure.

Today was my second visit and I found it to be just as excellent as the first.  Very friendly staff and great service.  Try the warm olives if you haven't already done so.  I am hooked!  On the first visit I had an Antipasto platter.  Very tasty and really fresh meats and cheese.  Today I had the Italian sandwich.  Wonderful meld of flavors!  By the time we were done with lunch there was only room for coffee.  The next visit I will start with dessert and then worry about lunch or dinner.  I highly recommend giving this family owned jewel a try.

This bistro offers Super yummy food and has become another favorite of ours .  This business is locally and family owned , offers a nice  variety of dishes to choose from .   We will be using their catering service in the near future and have found Dina Zappone to be more than helpful in creating our menu within our budget !

It's definately on my hit list to be a regular. The food is great, the prices are good, and they have specials every day (Wednesday is half price on a bottle of wine). It's not big and the tables are not white cloth (not for a great romantic dinners) but a great place to meet family and friends.

This place is just awesome.  I love supporting family owned places.  The salads are amazing here. I LOVE the Caesar Salad, ask them to add some of the roasted red peppers to it to make it even more amazing.   They have great fresh bread, too.  I had the Lasagna.  I really love their red sauce.   I cannot wait to come back.  The prices are excellent or the amount and quality of food.  You MUST try this place if you like home cooked, not chain Italian food.

Always delicious, this is our go-to date-night spot. The staff is great, pasta is homemade heaven, and the salad included with entree is just right. It's an added treat that there is live music on Friday night. *My only wish for this place is that they would more often have plain cheese cake on the menu. We had the chef's plain cheese cake (with a little berry compote on top) the first time we went there and it was the best cheese cake I have ever had! Since then it's always been a particular flavor and it's good, but not nearly as wonderful as the plain. Some things don't need dressing up. :)

Zappones is such a cute little family owned Italian restaurant. Their food is phenomenal. My favorite is the vodka penne! I attended one of their cooking classes with was such a fun time with chef sal! They make you feel like family Sal and Dina are a wonderful team. They have a really good happy hour with half off wine on Wednesday! Sal also creates deserts which are heavenly! The cheesecakes and cannolis are to die for!!!

I really don't understand all the 5 star reviews. This place was average at best. Food took a very long time to come out even though the place didn't seem that busy.I had spaghetti and meatballs, my wife had chicken Parmesan, and the kids had cheese pizza. All very average, nothing was outstanding. Everything needed salt and more seasoning. Price wise, value was good.

My friend took me here for my birthday, and I loved my meal. I thought the atmosphere was cute and casual. I ordered the mussels, and the sauce was thick and flavorful. My friend ordered the lasagna, and it was super duper cheesy and delicious. I plan to go back and try other items on the menu.

We had such a great experience at lunch we had to try dinner before going back to CA.   Laura: Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo Pasta cooked perfectly and tastes fresh-made in the kitchen. Sauce creamy and delicate.  Brian: The Amatriciana This spicy red pasta has a beautiful bite and along with the pancetta, is one damn good dish.   The wait staff is amazing, especially our waitress Dina. The dining room is busy but the noise level is calming and the piped-in music must be sending subliminal signals: "You must enjoy and relax!"  Extra points: the music is playing Feist's "My Moon, My Man"
Chef Sal's menu has been updated for Fall 2014.  Today I had a Fried Calamari Salad and it was wonderful.  Highly recommended, it's almost a meal unto itself!

A client highly recommended this place because she knows we love good  Italian food. I ordered the chicken parm and my bf ordered spaghetti and meatballs. My chicken could have been cooked a little more, just a lil pink in the middle and was disappointed to see water from the pasta sitting in my bowl of spaghetti.  My bf's spaghetti also had water on his plate from the pasta to the point he literally poured I t onto a little bread plate.  Also, if you're a coke product fan, this place serves pepsi. Aside from that,  the service was very good, ambience was nice and they had live music on a friday night. Being we live in Chandler,  if we were in the area I might give it another shot.

This place was awesome and I'm so glad we tried it after seeing some friends check in on FB saying great things. They were right! My husband had the side Caesar salad and Chicken Parmesan and he said it was great, and I had a house side salad (delicious dressing and quality salad with cherry tomatoes, mixed greens, green olives) and Spaghetti w/ white clam sauce which was AWESOME! Tons of whole clams in the shell, delicious sauce, pasta cooked perfectly and a huge portion. We will definitely be returning to try more stuff (they had some appetizers that looked amazing) and we will absolutely recommend to friends!

pre pay & pre tip. I understand pre pay bistro style, but pre tip? you have to get your own drinks. Bruschetta was good, but pizza, pasta, & salads where meh. I'll give them another chance, but at least tell the servers to do more than just drop off food.  Went back after they remodeled & bar put in. The ambience is so much better & the food is good. 2 more stars!!

A hidden gem, a diamond in the rough no longer. I first tried out Zappone's on the day they opened as my daily commute takes me out front of the shopping center it is located in. Seeing a sign for 'Italian food coming soon' always garners my immediate attention (I'm hooked on pretty much any Italian dish). To think a nice new (locally owned) Italian restaurant would be located minutes from home, I was excited to try it out. Well, no more Superstition Spring national chain restaurants will do any longer!  The food and atmosphere here are great. Sal is a master in the kitchen along with his wife Dina. The staff has always been welcoming and accommodating. Although I don't get in as often as I'd like, they still remember your face each time you come in.   Many of our orders have been the 'take-out' variety due to a toddler at home. However, sitting down with a nice glass of wine and some great pizza always makes for an enjoyable time there. The calamari with the friend lemon was something I had not seen before but very tasty. The Chicken Pesto sandwich is very good and don't get me started on the homemade chips. Those things are straight out of a fairy tale! I'm a plain guy when it comes to the pasta, so penne and meatballs are right up my alley and the meatballs are fantastic.  I have one other favorite Italian restaurant in the East Valley (located in Tempe) but Zappone's sits right atop there with them. The bonus for me is the very convenient location to home and being along my daily work commute. Sadly, it is no longer an unknown hidden gem, but now all the better for everyone as they are truly deserving of the praise.
The food at this restaurant is incredible! You can't beat the homemade sauces & fresh pasta! My favorite is the fresh hot bread Chef Sal makes!

Came for Mother's Day and Zappone's did not disappoint!  It was awesome they had a set menu for that day they were extremely busy and lucky my boys made reservations for the last seating so it was pretty laid back as the staff knew it was winding down.    The food was delicious brought my mom and she loved her prime rib dinner.  You can never go wrong with any of their pasta dishes so we all enjoyed our dinners.  You could tell our waitress was tired but she still had a great attitude never did we feel rush to leave.    Thank you Zappone's for making our Mother's Day a great experience.

This is the best local Italian food that I've found. Apparently I'm not the only one that thinks do as they are packed most every evening. Truly the pasta sauces ante as good as what I had in Italy. This is a must try!

Good fairly new place. Owners were present and visible. Wait staff is attractive but very young and inexperienced. They need service training! We had the antipasto to begin-- took a very long time to come out of the kitchen but was good. We arrived at 6:03 but didn't get happy price on wine so had to pay 8$ a glass for house Pinot noir. Bread was excellent, served with oil and balsamic. We split the penne aka vodka. Still had a good amount of leftovers. Very good.  So, overall, a very nice place -- solid kitchen albeit a little slow. Prices were on the high side-- 50$ for two people exclusive of tip and we split the entree.  If they polish up the service they could have earned 5 stars.
Always amazing food and excellent service! Love this place. Super friendly and quick when I need lunch to go at work. The chicken pancetta is amazinggggg !
My son and I are gluten free and they made great efforts to ensure that we could eat there when we went with my in-laws. The GF mac and cheese was amazing. I crave it!

Just had the worst Mother's Day dining experience. Food was good but service was horrible. We were waited upon arriving and then our waitress basically disappeared after we placed our order. Someone else brought our food. We ran out of drinks twice during our stay. The first time we waited 10min and my wife had to track our waitress down to get refills. The 2nd time we never got refilled. This was disappointing as my wife got the $13 bottomless Bellini. They were very small glasses and she only got 2. Maybe that's their plan to make more money. We were done eating and had all our plates stacked waiting to actually look at the dessert menu. We waited 15min(at least, this is when I started timing) and no one came by. During this time my wife went up and got her own to go box. We finally even had to go up to the bar to ask for our check, this was another 10min after the last 15min I talked about. So basically done eating and getting our check 25min later. It was for my wife on Mother's Day so very dissappointed she got such horrible service.

I can see the owners vision with this cute little bistro.  My girlfriend and i have eaten here a few times and the overall ambience is very nice.  Here's a few observations from my meals at Zappones. 1- wine.....i NEVER drink when i go out to dinner because of the insane cost of a drink. Many times , almost as much as a meal. 7 bucks for a 1/2 a glass of wine stunned me.  I understand the science of selling alcohol but a few ounces for 7 bucks? The whole bottle might cost 5 ?  2- table bread.....not bad but needs something savory to go with the olive oil. Balsamic? Garlic spread?  3- portions.....the salads, calamari, lasagna etc were very small. This is not family style.  4- prices...a bit high for the portion size.  I just had their meatball sandwich last night which was reasonably priced (7.50)and very tastey. My girlfriend loves the lasagna as well.  1 coke, 1wine, lasagna and meatball sandwich-- with tip 35.00  Cute place, small portions, not cheap, tastey food

Awesome service! The food is made fresh and carefully crafted! Chef sal is a huge inspiration and makes amazing food! Love the pizzas! They are a must to try! The eggplant rollatini and the lasagna are a favorite as well! Keep up the awesome work!

The other night, my mom was in the mood for Italian food, specifically fettuccine alfredo. After looking through Yelp to find options nearby, we settled on Zappones.   Definitely impressed with their level of customer service. As a mom of a toddler, I know it can be a little challenging to eat out, so I usually come prepared with lots of things to keep my little one busy during the meal. What I love is that they give you an entire box of crayons with the kids coloring menu. My daughter had a blast using every color in the box to create her masterpiece.   Everyone was super friendly, numerous people stopped by our table to check in on us and ask how everything was.   The food was... Average. Nothing to write home about, but not a terrible experience either. I just found it to be a little bland. I ended up only eating two ravioli from my entire plate because I just couldn't stomach the calories if I didn't love it.  The manager was very gracious, when she thought that they had not finished my meal, or rather, barely touched it, she took it off the bill for me.  Again, amazing customer service. I may try to return again in the near future to give this place another chance, based solely on the Customer Service alone.

Read reviews and decided try it. We found the bruschetta sauce flavored well. They were good size for two and hearty. The homemade fresh bread was tasty. Had it been warmed it would have been even better. My Cesar salad was good. The house salad was a little too drenched in the vinegar estate. For the main dishes we ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the penne ala vodka. The sauce was great on the penne and the homemade meatballs err moist and seasoned well. The sauce was sweet and not too acidic or thick. My gripe is if your going to have homemade sauce and meatballs your pasta should be homemade also and I could tell it wasn't.  The service was good quality. We were seated right away and did not have to wait for anything.
Food and service was amazing!  We were in a hurry and they were so accommodating. Can't wait to go back so we can really enjoy it.
Fabulous Monday might spaghetti and meatballs!  Good Chopped Italian salad too.  Place was busy but we were served in a timely manner and our server was very efficient.

Was looking for some Italian this evening and found just the right place! Libby was our very attentive server who was fantastic. The food was beyond words. All of the items were made in house and you could tell great care went into the food. Hands down, this is where I will be going for my fix of some amazing food. I can't wait to bring friends, this will be a new regular spot for us!

My husband and I love this place. I love that they put green olives on our pizza instead of black ones. They are always so kind and quick to make modifications if you ask.  The chips are so stinkin good too. I have yet to try something there that I didn't love. This will forever been my favorite local pizza place.
The calamari is the best I've tasted with a hint of fresh garlic. The service is good-servers are friendly. The food is fresh and tasty. Feels like a good home made meals!

Wow. The absolute BEST fettuccine Alfredo I have ever had in my life. And I have been all over Italy! Every bite of this dish melted in my mouth. Best Italian food in this country, can't believe it's in my backyard here in Gilbert!
Finally found a great neighborhood Italian place. Seafood Fettuccine, Mushroom Fettuccini, and Fritto Misto were all fantastic.
We just ate there for the first time and everything was very enjoyable. The service was excellent too. We will definitely be coming back again.

Excellent service, food absolutely fantastic.  This is our new go to restaurant! We had come in a couple weeks ago for a catering tasting and Dina and Sam did a fabulous job on creating a menu for our venue.  Said we would return for a meal and we were not disappointed!  Best Italian cuisine around.

Food fell very short of traditional Italian. Food was bland and tasteless. Heard yelling and profanity from the kitchen. Thought my server was new from her inexperience come to find out she'd been there close to the time of restaurant opening. Will not return.

Came in with a coupon for a dinner salad, 1 topping large pizza, chicken riggatoni alfredo, and a slice of pumpkin marscapone cheesecake for $30.  Great coupon deal!  Salad was good.  Pizza was delicious with prosciutto on it, and the alfredo sauce was really good.  The pumpkin cheesecake was amazing, and according to the little sign on the table the whole cake goes for $36. I think it was better than cheesecake factory pumpkin cheesecake, and they charge an arm and a leg for those!  We'll be back!

My husband & I came for Valentine's Dinner and really enjoyed our dinner. Although it was a limited menu, the dinner was delicious and the service was great. We will come back for the shrimp pasta and cheesecake.

This restaurant is somewhat of a hidden gem! First time coming here, and I was greatly pleased. We came for lunch, which has a limited menu than the dinner menu. However, the selections provided enough of a variety that everyone could get what they truly wanted. The sever was very pleasant and worked hard, as I noticed she was the only one on the floor at the time we were there. I recommend the penne a la vodka with shrimp! My husband and I definitely will come back here for date night!

I would absolutely recommend this little restaurant. It is tucked away in a little strip mall, but that doesn't stop the food from being outstanding.   The Good:  The pasta is freshly made and absolutely excellent. I got the shrimp scampi and my husband got the lobster diavolo. There was a ton of shrimp in my dish with a lot of flavor. My husband's dish had an entire small lobster in it. The sauce was flavorful and spicy, but not so spicy that you have a hard time eating the dish. It was the perfect balance against the sweetness of the lobster. We were really impressed with the flavor and the amount of seafood we got.  The Not So Good:  The calamari appetizer is a little lacking in quantity. It was ok for the two of us, but if we had been there with one or two other people there would not have been enough for more than a few bites each. There was A TON of dipping sauce, though, but the creamier sauce was way too salty. The calamari itself was pretty good, but nothing special. The entrees more than make up for the calamari deficiencies, though.

"Homemade" ravioli was made in a factory and shipped frozen. The brand name must be Homemade, because there was nothing fresh about it. Mine was served ice cold with lukewarm "meat" sauce. When complaining, I was told "well, that's how it is" so I won't be back.

Just came for lunch for the first time. Had a couple of four peaks while waiting for my lunch. I was not expecting what came to my table.. Wow.. I ordered braised beef sliders... My goodness amazing and I don't know how to describe it... I know food and work in the food industry for over 20 yrs... My lunch was amazing... You should try the Zappones at least once. I am coming back to try dinner now. Owners are amazing and friendly. Check them out and when you do please yelp . Thanks

Our server was friendly, attentive, and made great recommendations, which we ultimately took. My raspberry Smash cocktail was amazing. The lobster mac was perfectly seasoned, with large pieces of lobster and the most delicious, rich sauce. Definitely will be back on my next trip to AZ!

Just got done with an early dinner. We had a coupon that gave us an appetizer and dinner for 20 buck.  This place is fairly new. We were the only ones in e place at 3:30 in the afternoon.   The food was very good. They know how to make real Italian dishes. The place it tucked back in a strip mall so I don't think they get much drive through traffic.  Anyway, it a hidden gem. You need to try it.

we have been looking for a good authentic Italian  restaurant in the east valley, This was not it.  Bread and Salad were good but then main course was a different story.  My wife and I both ordered spaghetti and meatballs the Monday night special.   First we only got one meatball even tho the menu says meatballs (pl) then the pasta it was boxed spaghetti you would get at the grocery store.   no respectable Italian restaurant would server boxed pasta. i was expecting a fresh pasta not something that is 50 cents a pound at the store.  Very disappointed  with this dinning experience.
Absolutely yummy! We had fried ravioli appetizers.  I had the eggplant parmesean and my husband had baked rigatoni.  Great meal but a little pricey.

So Thursday's special was 50% off pizza so I went all in. I ordered the "Popeye" and added prosciutto. Boy was it yummy. The crust was perfect and I am picky about my pizza crusts!  Really enjoyed it and got to bring half home for lunch the next day!    My husband ordered the lasagna with a meatball on the side. "That's a good meatball" exclaimed my husband after the first bite. The lasagna is made with homemade noodles and comes cheesy delicious. Needless to say, his plate was clean at the end.   And how can you ever come to an Italian restaurant and not try the desserts?  My favorite all time is the cannoli so they had me before we ordered dinner! The shell was fresh and crisp and the filling was light and delicious...and dipped in pistachios!  Amazing!!!  We will definitely come back because I hear I have to try the homemade cheesecake!    Twist my arm!!

Decided I'd try a longtime bookmark while "in the area."  (It took me 27 minutes to drive from Tempe's SWIHA to Gilbert's Rise Up Bakery, and then another four minutes to Zappone's.)  I'm so glad I did!  I was promptly greeted at the door, and I inquired if I had to sit at the bar to enjoy the happy hour menu, or would I be able to sit anywhere, and the greeter said I could sit anywhere.  I almost sat at the bar, but it's such as small space (five or six high bar chairs), and I didn't want to sit with my back to the front entrance, so I chose to sit at a red leather-backed booth/four-top.  Slightly dark indoors, but not too dark to drive me away.  I eat with my eyes as well as my mouth, y'know.  Happy hour menu features a $1 off house cocktails, $4 glasses of house wines, $4 well drinks, $3 drafts, 15% off wine bottles, a few $5 apps, a $5 Caesar salad, and a $3 bowl of "warm olives."  A shout-out to server Caressa, who made me feel so welcome; She was friendly, patient, and understanding in regards to my questions regarding food allergies.  No negative vibes here!  She also took my requests to sample three wines (a house red, a house white, and Cannon Ball Chardonnay-- I went with the $8 glass of Chardonnay). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=XVYmbangVxnZOzyg1iEY7A  Because of the terrific customer service shown to me, I decided I'd go with three courses:  Jake's Mac-n-Cheese, $5. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=vLtofR0wyZ6f_C4IiaCf8QLoved this dish featuring alfredo, mozzarella on penne and topped with pancetta!  Smoky and cheesy, and a lovely bite/chew from the penne, and a great value! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=s7n3g1f5GGZen1IDEA1gBA  Sausage & Onion Pizza, $5. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=Ab8QiySsWeWb65xnsbcuWwSo what if it looked like it might be soggy from the marinara sauce and its crust a bit thicker than I'd like it to be?  It had Italian sausage (from Chicago) on it- it had to be good!  And it was!  Enjoyed a small slice of the eight-inch pizza and had the rest boxed, for I was about to enjoy the second course... http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=DVDNPddHFaJZwbvSG8PsHw  Fettuccine Alfredo, with chicken, $16. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=c1-3ilR_MHMxirPZJu8Z0AI chose this entree, because it was one of two pasta entrees that did not include marinara** as an ingredient, it also featured one of the two pasta varieties made in-house!  (The other is ravioli.)  The sauce was silky smooth (no clumps!) and just salty enough to make me reach for "just one more" forkful.  Didn't feel greasy, either.  One of the best Alfredos I've had, and I'd definitely order it again. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=Ra4JlgX22HJRwTNnxLEPXw  I could've ended the meal there- I certainly ate more than I wanted, but the cheesecake was calling my name...   Mascarpone cheesecake, with blueberry compote, $6. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=MfPbCAC7dtAvz-eaVGtz7gThe desserts are made in-house, with the exception of the gelato and sorbettos, which come from Italy.  Couldn't try the sfogliatelle and cannoli due to the powdered sugar content, so cheesecake it had to be, and I was THRILLED!  It was beautiful to look at, fun to photograph, and very delightful to eat.  It had this golden-brown top layer that was so gratifying to cut through with a fork, and perfect-to-me center that was neither too firm, nor too whipped, and a not-very-sweet graham cracker crust.  The blueberry topping was exquisite!  I cannot gush about this sweet concoction enough!  I contemplated on taking a whole cheesecake home ($36) and appeased myself by planning on ordering one for Christmas, should Mom and I get an invitation to lunch/dinner.  While the holiday catering menu only listed Peppermint chocolate cheesecake as the only dessert option, Carissa told me I could ask for any flavor I wanted.  I quite fancied the one I tried tonight! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=1RuD3bxX6bS1FVpfTs3TAw  Miscela d'Oro Americano, $2.50, with $0.50 refills. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=jghr9T7Vkuc_crNbYO4bAw  Feast of the Seven Fishes menu, Dec. 9th, 6pm, $50 all-inclusive!  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=vT6GnHLad0qXRDnqLBIudg Holiday Pre-sale menu! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zappones-italian-bistro-gilbert?select=DuFrbCx-KnD7ROUxpK4Qfg  FYI, Zappone's also offers weekly dine-in specials!  $6 Spaghetti & meatballs with house salad on Mondays and Tuesdays; 50% off all wine bottles, all day Wednesdays; and Buy one pizza and get 50% off second pizza all day Thursdays.

It's always a treat to eat at ZAPPONE'S!!!  The staff is so friendly and efficient ... the ambiance delightful ... and the service and food is exceptional.  Last Saturday night our server was Baylee; she was delightful, attentive and informative and went above and beyond to take care of our party of four.  I have eaten several delicious entrees at ZAPPONE'S; but the Shrimp Creamy Pesto with rigatoni, artichokes and red peppers I had Saturday ranks near the top of my favorites!

We went to Zappone's with high expectations, a friend of mine raved about this place.   DH ordered the lasagna, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs.. dinner came with salad no soup.. that was a let down.. The salad a pile of spring greens (weeds) with a splash of a marinated red pepper on top. I am not a fan of the bagged greens I prefer romaine lettuce. The salad came with an oil dressing which was pleasant tasting.  Ordered a glass of house red ( $7.50 ) pricey but good  Dinner arrived, my spaghetti $9.50 was served with a runny tomato sauce that was very salty, tasted like a can of crushed tomatoes, on top of my pasta was two meat balls that were cold and clearly just placed there..  Husbands lasagna $12.50 , was also a soupy mess lots of cheese not much else   Servings were not what I would call generous, which doesnt bother me if food is edible.   We left without eating the dinner, we offered to pay for the wine which was best part of the dinner service..  Waitress comped the wine. I do not understand all the rave reviews I have to agree with the others who left 3 or less stars.  I Think  Robert Irvine would agree this food was horrible

Zappone's offers $5 customer appreciation lunches once a month. How cool is that!? The restaurant was packed when we came here on Tuesday, but we were seated promptly and our orders were taken on a fairly quick amount of time.  I chose the chicken caprese sandwich, which came with your choice of salad or chips (Caesar salad for me). The bread with the sandwich was superb. The outer crispy crust contrasted well with the moist, soft texture of the bread. The chicken was tender and flavorful, and the basil/mozzarella combination was excellent. The salad was crisp and refreshing. It was quite a lot of food for $5!  Service was good despite the large number of patrons. Drinks were refilled as needed and the owner and staff were very friendly.  I believe the lunch special runs on the first Tuesday of the month. I'll definitely be back to try more of their dishes on other days though!

Zappone's catering is a first class experience!!! My family event of 100 people would not have been the same without Zappone's. Our guests are still raving about how amazing and authentic their food was, and also how kind and hospitable their staff was for our event. It was first class service through and through. We can't wait to go back and have dinner at the restaurant! You will not be disappointed using Zappone's catering. Dina was incredible with all of the details and no one skipped a beat from the beginning to end. Great owners, great staff, and great food!! My family and I can't thank you enough for helping us put on such a memorable event!

Wanted to try this place out for a while, and It didn't disappoint.  Upon being seated, we were told they have a $5.99 Spaghetti & meatball with house salad special on Monday and Tuesday nights.  We tried that, and it was good.  Bread was also served. And, we tried a flight of 3 wines for $7.00.   Bill total was under $23.00 (also had iced tea) before tip.  Service was attentive and friendly.  We will be back to try other dishes!
YUM! Our first time here today and it blew us away. The homemade ravioli is out of this world and there is really nothing like fresh pasta! And those MEATBALLS! We will be regulars!
Our favorite place for Italian. So good. Very authentic and fresh. Good wine, good food and live music tonight. Yeah! This is a regular stop for us.

On our last full day here in AZ, my boyfriend and I had lunch here with my mom and my sister. I got the mussels arribiatta and the first thing I noticed was that the pasta tasted fresh, not something from the box. Delicious. I tried some of my mom's chicken parm sandwich and again, the freshness of the food really shown through. Portions were a good size all around and priced very reasonably. We left full and satisfied. Next time, I'm getting that chicken parm sandwich!

Had a solid dinner here, and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Their pizza is tasty and prepared well, with generous toppings and a nice thin crisp. The Italian sampler, fried gnocchi, salad and bread were all very tasty. However, I'm more than a bit peeved at their menu- online they have a lot of good offerings that aren't represented on the menu. I understand that veal probably wasn't a huge seller for them, but I love it, and I was excited to try some when I got there. I noticed that it wasn't on their menu, so when I asked the server, she said that they had taken it off. Their website needs to be updated to reflect that, unless they plan to bring it back... in which case I'd definitely come back.  The restaurant itself is cozy and friendly, and seems like it would be a nice place to come split a bottle of wine with a loved one. However, with the draconian policies of Arizona police regarding Tent City, I won't be partaking of that particular treat. However if you're staying at a nearby hotel, this would be a great place to come try!

Coming out of review hibernation to sing the praises of Zappone's. Fiance & I have been here at least 6 times in the past handful of months... I've ordered a variety of things off their menu and have NEVER been disappointed. And I'm a little picky about my Italian food.   None of their sauces are too sweet (I have a major beef with sugared down sauce)... lasagna, ravioli, gnocchi, tortelloni... all amazing!  And for those cannoli purists out there, yes, their cannoli are made with ricotta and not cream. I know that was a big selling point for my mom. ;)  To those older reviews who complained about having to pre-pay & pre-tip, this is no longer a thing at Zappone's.  Servers are super friendly and amazing. I always enjoy my visits here.
Great food and awesome service.  Erin was attentive and very helpful.  The bruschetta trio was wonderful and each of us ordered something different and really enjoyed it!

My friends and I did our monthly dinner at Zappone's on the 11th. Neither of us ever been there before so we crossed our fingers hoping it would be good. The restaurant is a lot smaller than I thought it would be. Walked in and was surprised.  With being a small establishment, the tables are small as well so that's another drawback.  Service was kind of slow considering it was a Friday. After placing the dinner order, it took a good 30-35 minutes to get the food. Could of been longer. All I know is I was hungry lol. The appetizer bread was good and soft, but the olive oil & balsamic vinegar concoction that came with it had too much balsamic so that was a no. I had the chicken saltimbocca and I really liked it. It was seasoned well with a good flavor.

Dueling pianos (electric keyboards)! I don't know how often they do it but it is essential to try it at least once. Food and drinks were  very inexpensive and they give you the right size portion. The crowd is mostly 70 and up which was my favorite part, they know the words to every song from the 30s to the 70s.   I live in Cali so I can't say I will come back, but if they had something like this in Cali I would be a regular.

Nice place for lunch with friends. Most of us had the chicken calabrese sandwich--delish. Very hearty and the house made chips were good though one or two of them were soggy. Service was very attentive but not intrusive. I wish they had a round table--much better for 6 people to be able to talk.

This is one of the prospective places my brother and his fiance are looking to cater their wedding. Coming from a big italian family, my parents stressed to him that he needed to have good food at the wedding. As I am visiting him, they took me here to try the food and give my NY verdict.   We started with the fried gnocchi, which were a pleasant surprise. The shell of it almost had an egg roll crunch to it, and inside, I have no idea what was inside of it, but it was delicious. Inside the gnocchi must've been a mix of cheese and a light sauce. Very yummy, and would be a big hit if it made its rounds at the wedding. I ordered the caesar salad as a side, the dressing was a bit watery but tasted well.  I ordered the pasta amatriciana. While it was a good dish there were some elements of it that just needed some fixing for me. The onions stood out, they just didn't feel like they belonged. Perhaps if they were caramelized instead it would gel better. Also, the dish needed more pancetta. The pancetta will sweeten the sauce more and bring out the flavors instead of them all meshing in.  For dessert we had the italian sampler platter. It consists of cannoli, panna cotta, and cheesecake. The cannoli were great, the pistachio crumbs really gave the cream a nice nutty flavor. The panna cotta was good as well, the first time I ever had panna cotta was in italy, so I have pretty high standards for it. This panna cotta stands up well to it. It wasn't as thick and it wasn't as creamy, but the taste was there for it. The cheesecake was delicious as well. My brother said this wasn't the cheesecake they had sampled that would be apart of the wedding selection, but it still would've been a good choice. (The one for the wedding would've been the marscapone one).   I think if my brother and his fiance chose this caterer for the wedding my family would be happy, and I know my brother and his fiance are happy with it so it would be a great win-win.

Food was good! I'd say a little above average but great flavors. Went on a Saturday night and they were packed. They offered house bread while waiting.  The food was good quality but I'm only giving a 3 star since it was expensive. Basic Fettuccine Alfredo was $13.00, +$4.00 for shrimp.

I'm not quire sure why all the 4 stars.  I mean, the food was average.  Good, but not that memorable.  My husband and I shared the toasted ravioli and calamari - both were cooked perfectly.  But what took it from wonderful to mediocre was the tomato sauce.  Both appetizers came with the same sauce that might as well have been out of a can.  In fact, the first thing my husband said about the ravioli was, "It reminds me of Chef Boyardee."  Indeed.  We then shared the chicken pasta with pesto sauce, and it was just a little too salty for me.  Although I have to say that the pesto sauce was much more exciting than the tomato sauce.  The chicken was cooked well and was not dry.  As other reviewers mentioned, the portions are a little on the small side.  The service was friendly and attentive, and if I could, I'd give this place 4 stars.  But because I feel like I could have had this same food anywhere else, it just doesn't quite get there for me.

Truly amazing!!! Jakes Mac and cheese, penne alavodka, lasagna, pizza, bread absolutely amazing! Don't even get me started on the desserts. The cheesecake was heaven!! The owners are so lovely and you can tell they love what they do!! We will be back regularly!!!

Great service and great Italian food!  We are so happy to have found this place.     The mussels in white sauce are awesome.  The bottle of Capezzana (Red blend) was a great suggestion for our meal.    We felt right at home thanks to the owner  and servers and we will be back soon to sample the other menu options.

I ordered the special of the night which was a lobster shrimp fettuccine with a basil cream sauce. It was so good I literally high fived myself. The lobster pieces were generous and succulent. The shrimp was tender and also plentiful. The pasta was the perfect vehicle for mixing the cram sauce and fresh basil into every mouthful. Usually a very good dish will make me eat it so fast that I don't give myself a chance to taste it properly. But the completely arresting yet subtle flavors forced me to take only a modest mouthful each time so that I could properly savor the warm buttery richness of the lobster. I was at the mercy of the meal. And I joyfully submitted to its magnificence. I closed my eyes with every mouthful and for a moment I forgot where I was and who I was. But I'm back now and I will return.  Tina was a fabulous server. She does not allow any mistakes and her recommendations are spot on.

Saw the Chef on Channel 3 and everything he prepared for them looked amazing and so fresh.  I was very excited to try it.     The service was great, we were seated quickly, our waitress was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered an appetizer - the fried gnocchi.  Great!  Crispy on the outside and cheesy gooey on the inside.  The caesar salads were ok, nothing special.    My husband ordered the veal manicotti and I ordered the eggplant rollatini.  The manicotti filling was a little under-seasoned so it was just ok.  The eggplant however, tasted like the freezer.  Weird.  Why would they freeze eggplant?  I thought it didn't make sense so it must just be me.  I ate the filling out of it and pushed the weird tasting eggplant to the side.  Then we decided to split the desert sampler.  The Sfogliatelle was DELICIOUS!  But the Rum Baba had that same gross freezer taste again.  I asked the waitress and she confirmed that the desserts do come in frozen...blech.  Don't waste your time on that one - (unless it is for the visuals because lets just say - it's a great looking dessert for a bachelorette party).    I don't get all the 5 star reviews for this place.  We must've ordered the wrong things.  After tax and tip we left $100 lighter and I really don't feel like it was worth it.

1st let me open with this: I had high hopes for this pizza after reading the reviews. It was ready promptly which kept those hopes alive. But alas, those hopes were quickly dashed after the first bite. Let me follow that opening with this closer: I ordered the pie for my wife and I in an effort to avoid the pain, sorrow and agony of eating the cafeteria food at the hospital where we were after the birth of our child. After the 1st bite though I realized that I had these food items situationally reversed and began eating the cafeteria food...with vigor. I am not sure I can say much more than that. When given the choice between a cold quesadilla and this pizza there were only 2 viable options: eat the cold cafeteria quesadilla or throw away the pizza and eat the box. I went with option 1 as the box had some of the pizza sauce on it and wasn't made from recycled material.

Went for a Valentines day lunch! So glad I did. It really is a hidden gem. My husband got the chicken marsala and says he will get it again the next time we come. I got the casa salad which was so good. But their bread and desserts can't be beat. We had a hazelnut gelato. So many good quality options!

If you want to be discriminated against, this is the restaurant for you. I have been to thousands and thousands of restaurants in my life, everything from Dives to high scale, high-class, six star restaurants where you have to dress to the nines to even get in the door. I have never ever once been treated as shitty as I did last night at this restaurant. And I mean never. I cannot say that enough. I had the worst experience here last night that I have ever had in my entire life at any restaurant. And I am not exaggerating. I am so mad and so upset and hurt by the treatment that we received last night. My boyfriend and I just moved here to Gilbert from California to help my sister because she is very sick. We took my sister to this restaurant, because she was raving about it. Well, I don't know what the Rave was about, and after our experience, none of us, not even my sister, will ever return. We timed everything. It took exactly 26 minutes for a waitress to approach our table for anything.She approached her table 26 minutes after we sat down. That is beyond inexcusable. She and another waitress walked by our table so many effing times before we even got any service. And the manager, in the burgundy shirt, the joke of a manager that she is, also walked by our table 9 times at least, and did not take one look at us. I think the manager pissed me off more than the waitress, if that's even possible. We quickly learned by watching her and the waitresses interactions with all of the other guests, that if you're not a regular here, you get ignored and treated like shit. You get shitty shitty service unless you're a regular. If you're a regular, they wait on you hand and foot. Every other table, and I'm not exaggerating, every other table except for ours, had both waitresses and the manager waiting on them hand and foot, all night long. And if you were drinking wine, that was an even bigger plus. The manager was flipping out over the people drinking wine for some reason. I don't know what the deal is with that, but she couldn't get enough of the people that were drinking wine. She was constantly refilling their glasses with wine. The manager also came around all night long with a pitcher of ice water and filled everybody's glass of water except for ours! No joke. She walked by our table all night long, and never even glanced our way. Speaking of which, it took our waitress 18 minutes after ordering our drinks before we even got our drinks brought to us. The only reason we got our drinks brought to us at all is because I had to ask 2 different Busboys to go get our drinks. That was like I said, 18 minutes after we ordered drinks. Then we ordered garlic bread, that tasted like shit. It was very doughy and not good at all. Then they brought us Caesar salads, which tasted like it was right out of a bag! It was disgusting. We had to ask for everything from other people. Our waitress never brought one single thing that we ordered. We had to ask Busboys to get our stuff for us all night long. My glass of ice tea was sitting there empty, for 26 minutes. I timed everything as you can tell. I had to ask 3 times for my iced tea refilled in that 26 minutes before I even got it. We had to then wait another 12 minutes for dessert, and another 13 minutes after that for our check. I just cannot stress enough how utterly shocked and in disbelief I was over the treatment that every other table got. People ranging from young to old, getting treated like absolute royalty! Absolute Royalty. Two waitresses and a manager waiting on them hand and foot all night long!  the men sitting next to us, you would think that they were celebrities for god sakes. I cannot believe how well they got treated. The manager was at their table all night long chatting it up with them, offering them this that and the other, offering them coupons and discounts, I just could not believe my eyes. That manager is absolutely disgusting. I can't even believe that she freaking works there. She should definitely not be a manager. This place is an effing effing joke and I will share my experience EVERYWHERE so that EVERYONE in Arizona knows about this place!!!!  you guys are absolutely pathetic and you should not be in business, that is how bad you guys treated us last night!!! One last thing to think about..... How do you expect one to become a regular, when you don't give them a chance to come back?

We ate here for the first time over the weekend. The food was delicious!  The staff was friendly ans accommodating. We truly enjoyed the live music! I had the chicken Marsala and my husband had chicken Parmesan. We also had calamari and the spumoni for dessert!  Overall wonderful experience and we will definitely be back soon!

Just had date night with the hubby here, we've been wanting to try it because it's so close to home.    It's cute inside when you walk in. Doesn't hold a lot of people, and for a strip mall it's cute.   Ordered bruschetta trio- to be honest I hated the fig jam and prosciutto one. Yuck. The ricotta cheese and red bell pepper was ok, a little flavorless. But the caprese one was fantastic! The bread for the bruschetta was really yummy.   Had the corleone pizza- I really liked the crust and sauce but I felt like the cheese was a little cheap and the grease was abundant.   I will definitely come back and order pasta and a salad next time. It is way better than Salernos up the street.

We just came from having the BEST pizza we have ever eaten.  We had the Sicilian and added artichokes.  Unbelievably delicious, Artisan style and fresh.  It was wonderful.  The owner/cook and entire staff made their way over to our table just to greet us.  They sell homemade french bread and rosemary/kalamata olive french bread.  Took two loaves home.  Don't listen to one word negative about the restaurant, service or food.  It really was delightful.   fyi:  to Lenne O from Denver...  You must have been in the pizza restaurant across the parking lot because 1)you do not serve your own beverage  2) there isn't a chalkboard and 3) you don't prepay or pre-tip.  None of that...

I'm a little late writing this review but I had to share how wonderful Zappone's is! My mom and stepfather were visiting me from upstate NY (where I grew up!) Let's just say we know Italian food!   We went early on a week night and were immediately greeted by the hostess, who I believe is the owner. I ordered a delicious  Limoncello Sangria and truffle parmesan chips to start. I will eat anything with truffle oil on it! These were out of this world! They were home made chips that we're so tasty.  For entrees I ordered the wild mushroom fettuccine with you gussed it, truffle oil! My parents each had the special of spaghetti and meatballs. It was ridiculously cheap and a huge portion for like $6.   My mom said it reminded her of my great grandmother's sauce when she was a child. My great grandmother was from Italy, so that is a huge compliment. We all agreed it's better than any Italian food we ever had in NY!  For dessert I had canollis!! You can rarely find decent ones in Phoenix so I was pleasantly surprised to see them on the menu.   A few days later my stepfather stopped in for a pizza while my mom and I were out shopping. I had a leftover slice and it's definitely the NY pizza I miss being in AZ.   You won't be disappointed if you stop by and it's so nice to support a locally owned family business! I can't wait to bring my husband to try it out on date night.

Went here yesterday (3-30-13) with my wife. Started out with an appetizer of Bruschetta then main course. Bruschetta was excellent, was six half slices of bread with 3 different types of Bruschetta. I had the Chicken Piccata  and my wife had the Gnocchi.  My Piccata was excellent,chicken over spinach and capers with a white sauce and plate of pasta on the side. The Gnocchi came with a tomato meat sauce (over or on the side) very good also. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. Oh yes. the waitstaff  was among the most friendly I have ever had at a restaurant.

Pretty tasty and fresh food (especially the salads) but it took a very, very long time to get food. Like 40+ minutes for a medium pizza and a bowl of rigatoni..and it was a Wednesday night and the restaurant was half full, so I'm not sure what the hold up was.   The arugula,  pear, and prosciutto salad was great but the lemon vinaigrette was too acidic. Pizza is good but the crust was very chewy. Overall quality of ingredients was very good.

I found this place on Yelp. I always get my food to go. After work or on my way to work. I have tried a majority of the pasta dishes all 5 stars. The pizza I would give a 3. The salads are fresh and taste fresh.  I recommend this place to all my neighbors and friends. Everyone tells me how thankful they are I did. Every time I come in they are dead. More people need to know about this place!! It's the best. I know if more people knew how great it was and found them when they were looking it would boom!   The service is always good to! Love love love this place! It deserves to have more traffic.

By far the best Italian food in the Valley! My husband had the wild mushroom with beef and I had the cheese tortellini with peas and pancetta, both were amazing!Excellent service and very friendly staff as well, we will definitely be back!

I only come to Arizona once a year for work, but Zappone's is always on my "must" list. The staff really know their wine list and make excellent recommendations. They also give off a very friendly and warm vibe. The service has always been on point.  The food is exceptional. The pasta is always cooked perfectly, and the sauces are the right combination of flavor, richness, texture, and in the right quantity. I had a mushroom fettuccine dish at the server's recommendation, and it was an excellent call. I also tried the tiramisu at the chef's recommendation (who came out to the table to greet our small group), which had a lovely decadent flavor and texture. It was a well-balanced finisher for the meal.  The only downside is that this place is a state away from me! I'm definitely looking forward to returning next year.

The pizza is outstanding!  I usually eat 2, sometime 3 slices of a large pizza, today I had 5! I couldn't stop eating it.  Wonderful sauce & cheese, the crust is thin and slightly crisp, cooked to perfection.  The only down side for us was the pasta red sauce was slightly too sweet and almost every menu item had ham in it, I'm not a ham fan. but that's just me.  The place is clean and decorated very nicely, the owners are supper nice and service is top notch (even though you order at the counter, they take care of you after that).  We will definitely be back.
New find for my wife and I. We recently travelled to Italy. This place is the closest food and experience we found in Italy!  Great service too!

Last night was my first time to eat at this restaurant. We came in late, and they appeared to be closing up, we asked if we could be seated even though it was late, and they were very friendly and welcoming. I was surprised at the speed of the service. The food was extremely delicious. The Spaghetti and meatballs, although a simple dish was very very good. I had the chicken piccata, and the pasta served alongside it was amazing. My sister had the meatball sandwich, and I ended up eating half of her meal. I could not believe how good it was.   This restaurant is a rare treat, in a plain strip mall. I hope they stay busy and I hope they never close.

Came out to lunch with my daughter an fiancée found this place on yelp so thought we would try it out. We had a pepperoni pizza a cheese pizza an a pasta with rose an red wine was unbelievably good an tried the Cannolis  very good the people there are so friendly an we will defiantly be going back again for date night

My husband and I wanted to try a new Italian place and he found this one online.  We are sure glad we decided to check it out.  Not only was the food amazing, but so was the service.  We went in about 5 PM on a Saturday, so well before the dinner rush because we wanted to check out the happy hour.  We had drinks, an appetizer, salad, main course, after dinner drinks and dessert.  Each course was timed perfectly.  Our glasses were never empty, and the food....well it was amazing!  Fresh made bread was wonderful, they make their own mozzarella in house and even some of their pasta is made there.  Try the Cheesecake!  We will for sure be back and the prices were very reasonable.

Best Italian I've ever had! Nothing I've eaten in Rome, Florence or Venice was better. Every morsel is delectable. Good size portions. Perfectly prepared and nicely presented. You will not be disappointed! Even the bread and croutons are delicious.
We had prosciutto arugula salad and old Chicago pizza. The salad was very bland and the pizza was oozing oily giardiniera. It was an expensive unsatisfying dinner.
Amazing!!! The staff are great and the food is even better.  Shrimp linguine in rosé sauce is to die for!

First of all, it was way too loud in here.  We ordered a pizza and asked for "light/easy cheese."  When we got the pizza it was as if they went heavy with the cheese.  There was so much cheese on the pizza we peeled it off and there was at least 1/2 cup of cheese on each slice.  Way too much cheese!!!!!!  Not to mention it was so greasy you could have poured the grease off of each slice.  The crust was the best part.  Also, the price was good...not overpriced.

Wow, all these people giving 5 stars? This place is just ok.    Promising: half price bottles of wine on Tuesdays.  Server recommended the Malbec, which I enjoyed and took home the rest of the bottle.  Fried ravioli app: tasty but nothing special. Marinara was decent.  Caesar salad. Yep, I agree with other reviewers.  Tasteless. Desperately needs anchovies.  Bread: Very fresh, but again, agree with other reviewers, olive oil dip is worthless. Maybe a little more balsamic?  Dipping it in the marinara was definitely the way to go.  Ameriabiatta(?) With sausage: tasty sauce but lacking in meat.  Penne ala vodka with chicken: a bit lacking in flavor and sauce. Chicken was those little frozen chicken chunks from Costco. Wtf? The owner lady stopped by so we asked how it was cooked. She says it's caramelized in the pizza oven. Uh, what? Chicken doesn't caramelize.  I think maybe it was thawed in the pizza oven.  I definitely could have made this dish better myself.  Service: no complaints. Server was helpful and attentive.   Overall:  Glad I had a $10 for $20 living social coupon, otherwise would've been very overpriced for an okay but not awe inspiring meal.  Menu is limited, ingredients aren't high quality.  Next time I want Italian I'll go to Baci's Italian bistro. See my other review for true awesomeness.

Been here 2x now! Absolutely my NEW FAVORITE italian reasturant!! I love how fresh everything is!!!! Excellent Customer Service! My only complaint would be that both times ive ordered the Alfredo Cheese Tortellini and they were out of tortellini which was a bummer especially 2 different times.. they did substitute with Cheese Ravioli but i would think if they run out of a certain dish so fast and often they would place a bigger order for it, but overall the dish was still fantastic!!!
Pretty good stuff.  I cam here late, and they were very accommodating.  The food was good and pretty reasonably priced.  I'll be back.

I have since been back 3 times and I don't understand why they can't make a decent pizza.  I do not like pizza's that come out soggy in the middle.  I have now ordered it twice and both times I asked for well done and it came out soggy.  On a positive note the 5.99 spaghetti and a meatball is super value for lunch or even at dinner on Monday and Tuesday.

Update to review:  Went in last night with a party of 7 to include an out of town guest and an elderly grandmother. That's when we realized the place is really set up well for large groups. We could have had 25 people in the group and it would have worked.    There were two hiccups with the food. Nothing major, just a slight delay on two dishes. We didn't complain at all. This is more of an "Artisan" type restaurant where the meals are hand crafted vs. Assembly line that you would get elsewhere so there has to be a little trade-off. If a chef has to make a number of different dishes, things are bound to not run smoothly.  Even though we didn't care, they still apologized SINCERELY each time they updated us, delivered the food and then checked on the food. They really care. Much to our surprise, the owner took items off of the bill for the inconvenience. THIS PLACE CARES.  Excellent management, staff, ownership and attitude. Please dine here when you can. Even if you're a little let down they make it up a lot.  First review: This place is amazing. If you're looking for authentic and absolutely delicious Italian fare, come to this place.  It's in a strip mall setting so you don't have to worry about parking. Inside, the seating is plentiful. I normally hate sitting at two-tops or non-booth tables but I wouldn't mind it here. It's laid out very well.  The owner, Dina, was very friendly. Her husband is the chef and he is AMAZING. The server was also really sweet. She was able to describe the food selection very well. When asked about the choice of two different wines, she admitted she wasn't going to fake expertise and insisted on asking for the best answer from I guess the owner or chef. She did right by us.  The mussels were awesome. The sauce was delicious. We also had the bruschetta trio and it blew away Postino's bruschetta and we really love their fare. The entrees were great. We had chicken with pancetta and vegetables and also had their homemade fettuccine with braised beef and mushrooms. Really delicious food. This isn't some kind of hit or miss restaurant. They make their cheesecake in the most amazing fashion.  For the quality of food and desert and service, the pricing was well worth it. We will definitely be back.  Thank you Dina and staff for an absolutely great edperienc

Simple yet great Italian food. Eat here a few times a month for lunch. GREAT lunch special and everything is fresh. Just tastes great. Owners are great people and enjoy what they are doing. Been there twice for diner. Always a great meal. One of the few, very good Italian places in Gilbert.
Another great experience here!   Everything was dead on except the Eggplant which really needs help.  Other than that, great!   Service was average at best.   Food is rockin!

The lady on the phone who took my order, which I believe was the same one who helped me when I came in was very friendly, great customer service! I ordered the lasagna per her recommendation, it was good but not the best I've had. Great Caesar dressing but soft mush croutons killed it a bit for me. The bread was good, wish they put some butter in there for take out. Overall for about $12.50 I had a good dinner for the money, will be back to try something different.   The 1 man band on Sat night sounded pretty good and is something different for the area!
Customer service - great. Food - great. All around - very happy with my experience...I'm looking forward to going back!

We went here per recommendation. Its a small cute family owned (I'm guessing) restaurant. Minimal decor. Menu had a good variety to choose from so I had trouble deciding. I ended up getting the veal piccata (I've never had veal so I figured I would take the opportunity to try something new). Husband got the spaghetti and meatballs special. Which seemed to be common. We also ordered the cheesy garlic bread.  Both our meals came with salads. I got the Caesar and he got the house. I must say the Caesar salad was one of the best salads I've had. I really liked the flavor of the dressing.  My meal was really good. I liked they served the pasta on the side so I could mix it in as I wanted. Spaghetti and meatballs were good.   We will probably pass on the garlic bread next time. It's basically ciabatta bread loaded with butter and garlic oil with moz cheese on top. Which how could that be bad? Lol. But I think I would have enjoyed it more if the bread was actually toasted.  Service. Our waitress was great. The rest of the girls seemed really nice. They talked about the dueling pianos and music entertainment on the weekends.  There was one woman that was just running around like crazy. Kinda got the feeling she was the owner. Then there was a gentleman sitting at the bar with a computer talking to the staff. I'm guessing he was an owner too. They seemed to micromanage their staff a bit. Made us feel bad for their staff but everyone has their own way of doing business.  Can't say if we will be back. We don't normally go out for Italian food because we know we can make it at home for a lot less money.

This place is really good!  It is inviting and very nicely decorated.  The staff were all friendly and very attentive.  The food is the best part!!!  So much goodness.  Many things are made from scratch.  We had the calamari which came with 2 dipping sauces and both were very good.  We had a very yummy salad that was dressed just right.  We tried the gluten free pasta and I was pleasantly surprised!  It is not soggy or gummy at all, I could not tell a difference.  They import their gluten free pasta from Italy.  The best part of the meal was the cheesecake we had for dessert.  It was a creme brulee cheese cake served with caramel sauce and berries. The cheese cake itself isnt too sweet but it had the sugary crust that creme brulee has and it was AMAZING!!  Definitely the best piece of cheesecake Ive ever tried.  If you want to support a family run local business you need to try this place out!!  I will definitely be back for the dueling piano night they host once a month!

One thing I was worried about was the portion size. I wondered if I was going to feel satisfied. I had no reason to worry. The food is rich and flavorful. The staff is friendly and happy to see you. The prices were reasonable, also some real bargains on specials and wine. This should be you're neighborhood Italian restaurant.
Bomb as hell. Amazing service. Definitely coming back next time if im in the area. Thank you

Excellent Food and service!  Nice decor. Very enjoyable dining experience.  This  was my first visit and I'm sure it won't be the last.  I went early, around 4 PM, so I'm not able to advise of how busy they get or if reservations are recommended.

I really enjoy this little place, excellent salads, pizza, pasta and great sandwiches. The service is second to none, the atmosphere calming. Prices are fair maybe even inexpensive for what you get. The salads are unique and memorable.  The owners, husband and wife are always there and you can tell they take great pride in what they do. I recommend it for lunch or dinner.

Went with a couple of friends to enjoy food and company.  When we arrived we were quickly seated and drink orders taken.   I am a vegetarian and had no problem finding something on the menu.
