I ordered the eggplant parmesan and was not disappointed.   The homemade bread was delicious and service great.  We ran into some old friends and practically closed the place down getting caught up.

Amazing Food Fantastic Service!!!! This place is freakin amazing! The food is Real! They use fresh real ingredients no fake stuff here! In town for a business meeting, staying at the HamptoN up the road, we were looking for something close that had good food and this is it! We had the Tuscan chicken pizza one night, the chicken saltimboca and Chianti beef with the wild mushroom fettuccine the other night and it was all delicious. The staff is top notch Janessa took excellent care of us both nights, all the girls there are great at their job it's obvious they love what they do. Hands down best place we found. Can't say enough good things about this place! Oh and the drinks were super yummy too, our favorites were the coconut lime mojito and coconut pineapple colada. Also the cheesecake is the best I've ever had, very light and fluffy and absolutely exquisite! Give it a try you won't be sorry you did! P. S. Pizza is 50% off on Thursday.

Love this place. It's an intimate lil place. Staff is so personable. The food is just simply delicious . I been here a few times trying something new each time. My favorite so far is the shrimp fettuccine. Bruschettas are close behind .

This is a great little Italian restaurant the serves fresh creative foods. It has a reasonably priced wine list that features some great tastes. I have been there a number of times for both lunch and dinner. The only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the silverware. They use that flat tinny stuff with sharp edges. It is a pet peeve for me. All the chef's hard work to provide a great food experience is diminished when the sharp edge of the fork scrapes across your lips.

Here now for the first time. I had the Spaghetti w/meatball special. It came with a nice starter salad which was a bed of spring mix with olives, pimentos and a house vinaigrette dressing. A nice sized bowl of perfectly cooked pasta, a tasty sauce and a substantial meatball filled the tank nicely. Oh, don't forget the fresh bread for dipping. All for $5.99 ! I'll be back.

Excellent in every way!  Great family owned bistro with amazing food from Chef Sal!  We have been to Zappone's for lunch, dinner and special events.  The food is just amazing!  Owner's and their staff are friendly and service was fast every time.  I have not had anything here that I did not love!

Oh em gee I made the right decision when I picked this place for my birthday dinner.  Everything was delicious, service was attentive, and we will be back!  I really wanted to have their spumoni but I was too full!  The frito misto appetizer was to die for, best coating I've had on something fried, light, crisp, and not greasy at all.  The red sauce for the calamari was really good but the roasted red pepper coulis was scrumptious enough to eat with a spoon.  My husband had chicken marsala and the house salad, I had shrimp scampi rose and the Caesar salad.  All the pasta is obviously fresh as claimed, the sauces were delicious and not over salted, the salads were fresh, flavorful and well-dressed, and the proteins were tender and cooked just right.  Their pinot grigio is great too.  And they gave me a free mini cannoli for my birthday, which was sweet and very tasty.  Overall a great dinner which I look forward to reprising.

Friends treated me to dinner here tonight. It was a delightful surprise. Coming from NJ, I have found most Italian food in the East Valley to fall short of my expectations.   The menu is interesting. Tonight I chose the wild mushroom fettuccine which was delicious. The sauce was rich and flavorful, the pasta was freshly made on site and the bread added to the authenticity of the meal. The salad choices were Caesar or house. I chose the house which was garnished with olives and sun-dried tomatoes.   I will be back. Soon!

Just ate here yesterday and the one word that comes to mind is FRESH!  I was struck by how fresh the cheese, bread, and vegetables tasted -- everything seemed fresh and high quality.  I came at a fairly slow time of day (after the lunch rush), so the food came out fast; I've also been there on days when they've been slammed however, when food took a longer time to get to the table.  I don't see this as a huge problem though because it just shows that everything is cooked fresh -- this place is definitely no fast food joint!  The servers are always polite and kind.  I've had the Caprese and Casa salads and must say I prefer the Caprese.  The Casa comes with these round rolls of shaved fennel, which I'm not the biggest fan of.  The bread they bring to each table is freshly-baked and very good.  I prefer the garlic cheese bread with some marinara dipping sauce -- but your breath WILL smell.  Their lunch-size veggie pizza is delicious but very large and in my opinion, doesn't taste good left-over, so eat it all and welcome the food coma later.  ;)  Friends also really like their sandwiches.    Lunch specials run from 11-2.  Happy hour from 3-6.  And I guess they have live music some evenings too.  One of the best Italian places around!

We ended up here by accident & were pleasantly surprised. It was a busy night but the server was excellent & the food was delicious. My favorites were the lasagna & the flourless torte...soooo good. The Freshly made pasta was so worth it.
Excellent fare!  Well run at peak business, the manager us torally engaged.  Whoa, cheesy bread is to die for...

FANTASTIC!   The food is wonderful! You can really tell the pasta is homemade and the pizzas are great. The staff is so friendly and always ready to offer suggestions. My husband and I  are big fans and come back as often as possible.

A MUST TRY! This little gem is hidden in a strip mall next to the fitness works gym.  The owner is the chef. He comes and asks how your meal is after you are served. You just don't get that service anywhere. I always get the vodka sauce pasta with chicken, I love it so much I can't order anything else on the menu. You can taste the quality of the food. The bread is cooked fresh daily. Pastas are home made. The service is always exceptional. A restaurant of this quality is rare.
Love this place!  Delicious food, great service, good music!   Great job Zappones!  Way to go Gilbert!

We live in north Phoenix so nowhere near this area. Happened to be heading home after our nephew's school event. Yelped the area for some good Italian and found this place. My boyfriend had the spaghetti and meatballs, which I'd say was pretty good but nothing spectacular. I ordered chicken piccata. Holy Moses! A tender and very juicy chicken breast in a lemon cream sauce with capers. It was absolutely delicious! It came over a tasty pile of yellow and green zucchini squash slices, which I quickly devoured. I almost ordered more veggies but the dish also comes with a side of spaghetti Alfredo. I'm not a huge Alfredo fan. The menu says the dish comes with a side of pasta and I assumed it was a marinara dish. Boy was I wrong...and pleasantly so. That pasta bowl was pure perfection. Warm, creamy noodles that had the best flavor I've had from a pasta dish in quite some time. Also, an Italian guitarist serenaded the dining room with romantic songs, a nice touch.  As far away as we live from Zappones, I enjoyed their food so much that I'll return. It's so worth the 50 minute drive!
Second time is a charm.  Service is poor. Food I think is pretty average. Overall.. Food  lacked salt.  I think I am not coming back here.  It looks like a snow bird joint.

Just ok, not a hometown Italian place like I expected.  Our fried ravioli appetizer was way overdone, dry and fried hard. The sauce was good.  Pasta dishes were done with homemade pasta, just enough - no generous portions here.  I would have given one star more BUT when it came time for desert our table of four asked for coffee. The server said they had none. None? As in you don't serve coffee?  No, the coffee machine broke 3 DAYS AGO.  I thought she was kidding. Nope, she said a new one should be there in a day or so.  Unbelievable. How about picking up a Mr. coffee at the local Walmart to bridge the gap here guys? To me this shows poor management.  Did we have desert anyway? No, we walked across the parking lot to the Bosa doughnuts and got a coffee there.  Can't make this stuff up.

We've lived around the block for years and finally tried this place. Husband is very picky about Italian food, and we both loved it. If they don't bring bread ask for it: it's divine with the warm olives. Butternut ravioli and risotto was amazing: we will be back!

I recently found this restaurant when I was having a hankering for some good spaghetti and meatballs. I work in East Mesa and am not terribly familiar with mom & pop places nearby. I was blown away by how good this to-go order was! The pasta was al dente and the sauce was absolutely delicious. It also came with a generous portion of bread and a salad, all for a very reasonable price... about $10.   My next trip was only a week later (today) when I ordered the prosciutto and arugula panini. This sandwich is to die for! If you're a fan of this salty meat, you will not find a better one around. It is topped with provolone cheese, roasted red peppers, arugula, and a red wine vinegarette. I also received a side of potato chips which taste and appear to be homemade. Total came to $9.29 after tax.  There are many other items on the menu I would like to try. While some items are more expensive than others, keep in mind there is a lunch specials menu to choose from.   This will definitely be a new go-to place for me!

I found this place on yelp and had bookmarked it a while ago, so glad I did!   We decided to try this place last night l since we wanted Italian. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left everything was great!!  The atmosphere is just adorable with a cute little bar towards the back. Our server was awesome, very friendly and accommodating. The food is incredible - and quite possibly some of the best Italian food I've had here in Arizona! The restaurant does fun things with customers (cooking classes, dinner/opera nights, etc...)  Will most definitely be back - can't wait to take some of the cooking classes too!!

Great little Italian place. Awesome pizza..great fresh pasta. Owners are very nice treat u like family. Sometimes they even have groupons for 10 for 20$ I think. Definitely worth coming by would recommend it for anyone
